member.summary: Initializes a new from a standard and applies an HDR scale to the RGB channels.
member.param: The source color.
The scale factor to apply to the RGB channels.

member.name: M:GameCore.Drawing.HdrColor.#ctor(System.Int16,System.Int16,System.Int16,System.Int16)
member.summary: Initializes a new from explicit channel values.
member.param: The red channel value.
The green channel value.
The blue channel value.
The alpha channel value. Defaults to 255 (fully opaque).

member.summary: Implicitly converts a to an .

member.name: F:GameCore.EntitySystem.Data.Enum.ViewActorType.Unit
member.summary: Normal creature, has most of the features.

member.name: F:GameCore.EntitySystem.Data.Enum.ViewActorType.Projectile
member.summary: Cannot walk, can have mover, destroyed after killed.

member.name: F:GameCore.EntitySystem.Data.Enum.ViewActorType.Block
member.summary: Cannot walk, cannot have mover, but have customized static collision footprint.

member.name: F:GameCore.EntitySystem.Data.Enum.ViewActorType.Building
member.summary: Creature but cannot walk, can have customized dynamic collision footprint.

member.name: F:GameCore.EntitySystem.Data.Enum.ViewActorType.Destructible
member.summary: Cannot walk, cannot have mover, cannot have footprint.

member.name: P:GameCore.EntitySystem.Data.GameDataUnit.PrimitiveShape
member.summary: 单位的基本几何形状配置（单个形状）
member.remarks: 当单位没有复杂模型时，可以使用基本几何形状作为临时表现。 这些形状会在客户端自动创建并附着到单位上。 如果同时设置了PrimitiveShape和CompositeShapes，将优先使用CompositeShapes。

member.name: P:GameCore.EntitySystem.Data.GameDataUnit.CompositeShapes
member.summary: 单位的复合几何形状配置（多个形状组合）
member.remarks: 用于创建由多个基本形状组成的复杂表现，如机器人、建筑等。 数组中的形状会按照Priority排序后依次创建。

member.name: P:GameCore.EntitySystem.Data.GameDataUnit.DeathRemovalDelay
member.summary: The unit will be removed after this time when it is dead, it can still be revived during this time, the delay will be reset after revived. Does not work if the unit have a static footprint. Set to null means no delay.

member.name: P:GameCore.EntitySystem.Data.Struct.StatusBarSetting.DefaultOn
member.summary: Indicates whether the status bar is on by default.

member.name: P:GameCore.EntitySystem.Data.Struct.StatusBarSetting.DefaultStatusBar
member.summary: If the unit does not meet any relationship specified in the OverrideByRelationShip dictionary, the default status bar will be used.

member.name: P:GameCore.EntitySystem.Data.Struct.StatusBarSetting.OverrideByRelationShip
member.summary: If the player meets any relationship specified in the OverrideByRelationShip dictionary, the corresponding status bar will be used, has higher priority than .

member.name: T:GameCore.EntitySystem.Data.Struct.UpdateFlags
member.summary: Defines configuration flags that control how an entity is updated and behaves in the game world.
member.remarks: These flags determine which systems and capabilities are enabled for an entity, affecting performance and functionality. They are typically set based on the entity's data configuration and determine which components and behaviors are active.

member.name: P:GameCore.EntitySystem.Data.Struct.UpdateFlags.Walkable
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether the entity can walk or move through the world.
member.remarks: When true, the entity will have walking/movement capabilities enabled and can respond to movement commands.

member.name: P:GameCore.EntitySystem.Data.Struct.UpdateFlags.Turnable
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether the entity can turn or rotate.
member.remarks: When true, the entity can change its facing direction in response to commands or game logic.

member.name: P:GameCore.EntitySystem.Data.Struct.UpdateFlags.AllowMover
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether the entity can have mover components attached.
member.remarks: When true, the entity supports advanced movement systems like projectiles, guided movement, or special mover behaviors.

member.name: P:GameCore.EntitySystem.Data.Struct.UpdateFlags.DisableClientUpdate
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether client-side updates should be disabled for this entity.
member.remarks: When true, the entity will not perform certain update operations on the client side, typically used for performance optimization.

member.name: T:GameCore.EntitySystem.Entity
member.summary: Base class for all scene object that can can be interact dynamically.
member.remarks: Entity represents any interactive object in the game world such as units, buildings, items, or effects. It provides fundamental functionality for positioning, ownership, visibility, and lifecycle management. All entities exist within a scene and are associated with a player. They support hierarchical relationships through parent-child attachments and can be targeted by other game systems.

member.name: M:GameCore.EntitySystem.Entity.GetById(System.Int32)
member.summary: Retrieves an entity by its unique identifier.
member.param: The unique identifier of the entity to retrieve.
member.returns: The entity with the specified ID, or null if not found.

member.name: P:GameCore.EntitySystem.Entity.BearingSnapshot
member.summary: We set/get bearings via _viewActor, but we also have a snapshot of the bearings. So that after the unit is destroyed, we can still get the last known position and facing.
member.remarks: This snapshot preserves the last known state of the entity's position and facing direction even after the entity has been destroyed or is no longer valid. This is useful for effects, death animations, or other systems that need to reference the entity's final state.

member.name: P:GameCore.EntitySystem.Entity.ShouldIgnoreDamage
member.summary: Gets a value indicating whether this entity should ignore incoming damage.
member.remarks: By default, entities do not ignore damage. Derived classes can override this property to implement damage immunity based on states, effects, or other conditions.

member.name: P:GameCore.EntitySystem.Entity.Scene
member.summary: Gets the scene that contains this entity.
member.value: The scene object where this entity is located.

member.name: P:GameCore.EntitySystem.Entity.CanReceiveCommandRequest
member.summary: Gets a value indicating whether this entity can receive command requests from players or AI systems.
member.remarks: This property determines if the entity can be given orders such as move, attack, or use abilities. Derived classes may override this to implement specific logic for command reception.

member.name: M:GameCore.EntitySystem.Entity.ChangeOwner(GameCore.PlayerAndUsers.Player)
member.summary: Changes the ownership of this entity to a new player.
member.param: The player who will become the new owner of this entity.
member.returns: True if the ownership change was successful; otherwise, false.
member.remarks: This operation is only available on the server side and will update both the entity's player reference and the underlying view actor's ownership.

member.name: M:GameCore.EntitySystem.Entity.SwitchScene(GameCore.SceneSystem.Scene)
member.summary: Moves this entity from its current scene to a different scene.
member.param: The destination scene where the entity should be moved.
member.returns: True if the scene switch was successful; otherwise, false.
member.remarks: This operation will fail if the entity is not valid, already in the target scene, or has a parent entity (attached entities cannot switch scenes independently).

member.name: M:GameCore.EntitySystem.Entity.ChangeLink(System.Int32)
member.summary: Changes the data link hash for this entity, potentially altering its appearance or behavior.
member.param: The new link hash to apply to this entity.
member.returns: True if the link change was successful; otherwise, false.
member.remarks: This is used for morphing or transforming entities while preserving their identity. The hash corresponds to different data configurations that define the entity's properties.

member.name: P:GameCore.EntitySystem.Entity.GameCore#BaseInterface#ITarget#Entity
member.summary: Gets this entity as a target for targeting systems.

member.name: P:GameCore.EntitySystem.Entity.Facing
member.summary: Gets or sets the facing direction of this entity.
member.value: The angle representing the direction this entity is facing.
member.remarks: When setting the facing direction, the angle will be automatically normalized. If the entity is not valid, the getter returns the cached facing from the bearing snapshot.

member.name: M:GameCore.EntitySystem.Entity.SetFacing(GameCore.BaseType.Angle,System.TimeSpan)
member.summary: Sets the facing direction of this entity with animation over a specified duration.
member.param: The target facing direction.
The time span over which to rotate to the new facing direction.
member.remarks: This method allows for smooth rotation animations. The entity will gradually turn from its current facing to the specified direction over the given duration.

member.name: P:GameCore.EntitySystem.Entity.IsValid
member.summary: Gets a value indicating whether this entity is valid and can be used.
member.value: True if the entity is valid; otherwise, false.
member.remarks: An entity is considered valid if both the base object is valid and its underlying view actor exists and is valid. Invalid entities should not be used for game operations.

member.name: P:GameCore.EntitySystem.Entity.IsAlive
member.summary: Gets a value indicating whether this entity is alive and functional.
member.value: True if the entity is alive; otherwise, false.
member.remarks: By default, an entity is considered alive if it is valid. Derived classes such as Unit may override this to provide more specific life state logic.

member.name: M:GameCore.EntitySystem.Entity.MoveTo(GameCore.SceneSystem.ScenePoint)
member.summary: Sync Blink

member.name: P:GameCore.EntitySystem.Entity.Position
member.summary: Gets the current position of this entity in the scene.
member.value: The scene point representing this entity's position.
member.remarks: If the entity has a parent, returns the parent's position. Otherwise, returns the entity's own position from its view actor, or the cached position if invalid.

member.name: M:GameCore.EntitySystem.Entity.SetPosition(GameCore.SceneSystem.ScenePoint,System.Boolean,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Sets the position of this entity to the specified scene point.
member.param: The target position to move this entity to.
Whether to synchronize the position immediately (blink/teleport).
Whether to synchronize over distance for smooth movement.
member.returns: True if the position was set successfully; otherwise, false.
member.remarks: Entities with parents cannot have their position set directly. If the target scene is different from the current scene, this method will attempt to switch scenes first. On the server, the target scene must be loaded for the operation to succeed.

member.name: M:GameCore.EntitySystem.Entity.IsAncestorOf(GameCore.EntitySystem.Entity)
member.summary: Checks if this entity is an ancestor of another entity in the parent-child hierarchy.
member.param: The entity to check for descendant relationship.
member.returns: True if this entity is an ancestor of the other entity; otherwise, false.
member.remarks: This method traverses up the parent chain of the other entity to determine if this entity appears anywhere in that chain. Returns true if the entities are the same.

member.name: P:GameCore.EntitySystem.Entity.Parent
member.summary: Gets or sets the parent entity in the attachment hierarchy.
member.value: The parent entity, or null if this entity has no parent.
member.remarks: Setting the parent creates an attachment relationship where this entity will follow the parent's transformations. Setting to null detaches the entity. Circular parent-child relationships are prevented by throwing an exception.
member.exception: Thrown when attempting to set a parent that would create a circular reference.

member.name: P:GameCore.EntitySystem.Entity.TagComponents
member.summary: Gets the collection of tag components attached to this entity.
member.remarks: Tag components are singleton components identified by a unique tag. Each entity can have at most one component of each tag type.

member.name: M:GameCore.EntitySystem.Entity.GetTagComponent(GameCore.BaseType.ComponentTag)
member.summary: Retrieves a tag component of any type by its tag identifier.
member.param: The tag identifier of the component to retrieve.
member.returns: The tag component if found; otherwise, null.

member.name: M:GameCore.EntitySystem.Entity.GetTagComponent``1(GameCore.BaseType.ComponentTag)
member.summary: Retrieves a tag component of a specific type by its tag identifier.
member.typeparam: The specific type of tag component to retrieve.
member.param: The tag identifier of the component to retrieve.
member.returns: The tag component of the specified type if found; otherwise, null.

member.name: M:GameCore.EntitySystem.Entity.HasTagComponent(GameCore.BaseType.ComponentTag)
member.summary: Checks if this entity has a tag component with the specified tag.
member.param: The tag identifier to check for.
member.returns: True if the entity has a component with the specified tag; otherwise, false.

member.name: M:GameCore.EntitySystem.Entity.GetComponentSet``1
member.summary: Get component set of the entity. This create a read-only set of the component set.

member.name: P:GameCore.EntitySystem.Entity.EntityId
member.summary: Gets the unique identifier for this entity.
member.value: The entity's unique identifier used for synchronization and referencing.

member.name: P:GameCore.EntitySystem.Entity.Player
member.summary: Gets the player that owns this entity.
member.value: The player object representing the owner of this entity.

member.name: P:GameCore.EntitySystem.Entity.Filters
member.summary: Gets the set of unit filters that apply to this entity for targeting and selection purposes.
member.value: A set of unit filters, or null if no specific filters apply.
member.remarks: This property is typically overridden by derived classes to provide entity-specific filtering capabilities for targeting systems, AI, and other game mechanics.

member.name: P:GameCore.EntitySystem.Entity.SyncId
member.summary: Gets the synchronization identifier for this entity.
member.value: The entity's synchronization ID, which is the same as its EntityId.

member.name: P:GameCore.EntitySystem.Entity.SyncIdType
member.summary: Gets the type of synchronization ID used by this entity.
member.value: The synchronization ID type for entities.

member.name: P:GameCore.EntitySystem.Entity.ApproachableTarget
member.summary: Gets an interface for approaching this entity as a target.
member.value: The approachable target interface for this entity.
member.remarks: This interface is used by movement and pathfinding systems to determine how other entities can approach and interact with this entity.

member.name: M:GameCore.EntitySystem.Entity.Kill(GameCore.BaseType.DeathType,GameCore.Interface.IExecutionContext)
member.summary: Kills this entity with the specified death type and execution context.
member.param: The type of death that occurred (default: Normal).
The execution context that caused the death, if any.
member.remarks: This method triggers the EntityDeath event before destroying the entity. It provides a way to distinguish between different types of entity destruction for proper event handling and effects.

member.name: M:GameCore.EntitySystem.Entity.System#IDisposable#Dispose
member.summary: Releases all resources used by this entity.
member.remarks: This method implements the IDisposable pattern for proper resource cleanup. It should not be called directly; use Destroy() instead.

member.name: M:GameCore.EntitySystem.Entity.IsValidTargetTo(GameCore.EntitySystem.Entity,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Determines if this entity is a valid target for the specified caster.
member.param: The entity attempting to target this entity.
Whether this is a targeting request that requires visibility.
member.returns: True if this entity can be targeted by the caster; otherwise, false.
member.remarks: For an entity to be a valid target, it must be in the same scene as the caster. If this is a targeting request, the entity must also be visible to the caster.

member.name: M:GameCore.EntitySystem.Entity.SameScene(GameCore.BaseInterface.ITarget)
member.summary: Checks if this entity is in the same scene as the specified target.
member.param: The target to compare scenes with.
member.returns: True if both entities are in the same scene; otherwise, false.

member.name: M:GameCore.EntitySystem.Entity.CanBeSeen(GameCore.EntitySystem.Entity)
member.summary: Determines if this entity can be seen by the specified caster entity.
member.param: The entity attempting to see this entity.
member.returns: True if this entity is visible to the caster; otherwise, false.
member.remarks: Visibility rules differ between server and client. On the server, it uses the view actor's visibility system. On the client, it considers player relationships and local player privileges.

member.name: M:GameCore.EntitySystem.Entity.AngleTo(GameCore.BaseInterface.ITarget)
member.summary: Calculates the angle from this entity to the specified target.
member.param: The target to calculate the angle to.
member.returns: The angle to the target, or null if they are in different scenes.
member.remarks: If the entities are at the same position or are the same entity, returns the current facing direction. Otherwise, calculates the angle based on their positions.

member.name: M:GameCore.EntitySystem.Entity.VectorTargetPosition(GameCore.BaseInterface.ITarget,System.Double)
member.summary: Calculates a position at a specified vector length in the direction of the target.
member.param: The target to calculate the vector towards.
The length of the vector from this entity's position.
member.returns: The calculated scene point, or null if the target is in a different scene.
member.remarks: This method is useful for positioning effects, projectiles, or other objects at a specific distance in the direction of a target. The vector length is adjusted by this entity's interaction radius.

member.name: M:GameCore.EntitySystem.Entity.GetFilterTags(GameCore.EntitySystem.Entity,System.Collections.Generic.HashSet{GameCore.BaseType.UnitFilterTag}@)
member.summary: Populates the provided tag set with filter tags that describe this entity's relationship to the caster.
member.param: The entity requesting the filter information.
The set to populate with applicable filter tags.
member.remarks: This method determines relationship tags (Self, Player, Alliance, Enemy, Neutral) and visibility tags based on the relationship between this entity and the caster. The tags are used by targeting systems, AI, and other game mechanics for filtering.

member.name: T:GameCore.EntitySystem.Enum.EEntityState
member.summary: Defines states that can be applied to entities to track their current conditions and behaviors.
member.remarks: Entity states are used to track temporary conditions that affect entity behavior, such as movement states, combat states, or special conditions. This enum is extendable, allowing additional states to be defined in other parts of the codebase.

member.name: F:GameCore.EntitySystem.Enum.EEntityState.IsChangingPosition
member.summary: Indicates that the entity is currently in the process of changing its position.
member.remarks: This state is typically set when an entity begins moving and cleared when movement completes. It can be used to trigger position change events and manage movement-related behaviors.

member.name: T:GameCore.EntitySystem.Enum.EPropertyEntity
member.summary: Defines property types that can be associated with entities for networking and state management.
member.remarks: These properties represent data that can be synchronized between server and client or tracked for entities. This enum is extendable, allowing additional property types to be defined elsewhere.

member.name: F:GameCore.EntitySystem.Enum.EPropertyEntity.Components
member.summary: Represents component-related properties for the entity.
member.remarks: This property type is used to track and synchronize information about the entity's components, such as component state changes or component-specific data.

member.name: F:GameCore.EntitySystem.Enum.EntityState.IsChangingPosition
member.summary: Indicates that the entity is currently in the process of changing its position.
member.remarks: This state is typically set when an entity begins moving and cleared when movement completes. It can be used to trigger position change events and manage movement-related behaviors.

member.name: F:GameCore.EntitySystem.Enum.PropertyEntity.Components
member.summary: Represents component-related properties for the entity.
member.remarks: This property type is used to track and synchronize information about the entity's components, such as component state changes or component-specific data.

member.name: F:GameCore.EntitySystem.EPropertyUnit.Level
member.summary: The current level of the unit.

member.name: F:GameCore.EntitySystem.EPropertyUnit.Experience
member.summary: The experience points gained since the last level up.

member.name: F:GameCore.EntitySystem.EPropertyUnit.ExperienceToNextLevel
member.summary: The total experience points required to advance from the current level to the next level.

member.name: T:GameCore.EntitySystem.Team
member.summary: Represents a team that groups players together for shared objectives, visibility, and game mechanics.
member.remarks: Teams provide a way to organize players into groups that share common goals, resources, and visibility. Players on the same team typically have allied relationships and can cooperate in various game systems. Each team has a unique identifier and manages its member players automatically.

member.name: M:GameCore.EntitySystem.Team.ToString
member.summary: Returns a string representation of this team.
member.returns: A formatted string containing the team identifier.

member.name: P:GameCore.EntitySystem.Team.Id
member.summary: Gets the unique identifier for this team.
member.value: The team's unique integer identifier.

member.name: M:GameCore.EntitySystem.Team.GetAllPlayers
member.summary: Gets an array containing all players currently on this team.
member.returns: An array of all players belonging to this team.
member.remarks: This method creates a new array each time it's called to prevent external modification of the internal player collection. The returned array represents a snapshot of the team membership at the time of the call.

member.name: M:GameCore.EntitySystem.Team.AddPlayer(GameCore.PlayerAndUsers.Player)
member.summary: Adds a player to this team.
member.param: The player to add to this team.
member.remarks: If the player is already on this team, no action is taken. If the player belongs to another team, they will be automatically removed from their current team before being added to this one. On the server side, the player's Team property will be updated to reference this team.

member.name: M:GameCore.EntitySystem.Team.RemovePlayer(GameCore.PlayerAndUsers.Player)
member.summary: Removes a player from this team.
member.param: The player to remove from this team.
member.remarks: This method is called internally when a player switches teams or leaves the game. It should not be called directly; use AddPlayer on another team instead to transfer players.

member.name: M:GameCore.EntitySystem.Team.#ctor(System.Int32)
member.summary: Initializes a new team with the specified identifier.
member.param: The unique identifier for this team.
member.exception: Thrown when the team ID is not registered with the host system.
member.remarks: This constructor is private and should only be called through GetOrCreateById. The team must be pre-registered with the view system before it can be created.

member.name: M:GameCore.EntitySystem.Team.GetById(System.Int32)
member.summary: Retrieves an existing team by its identifier.
member.param: The unique identifier of the team to retrieve.
member.returns: The team with the specified ID, or null if no team exists with that ID.
member.remarks: This method only returns existing teams that have already been created. Use GetOrCreateById if you need to ensure a team exists.

member.name: M:GameCore.EntitySystem.Team.GetOrCreateById(System.Int32)
member.summary: Retrieves an existing team by its identifier, or creates a new one if it doesn't exist.
member.param: The unique identifier of the team to retrieve or create.
member.returns: The existing team with the specified ID, or a newly created team if none existed.
member.exception: Thrown when attempting to create a team with an ID that is not registered with the host system.
member.remarks: This method ensures that a team with the specified ID exists, creating it if necessary. The team ID must be pre-registered with the view system for creation to succeed.

member.name: T:GameCore.EntitySystem.Unit
member.summary: Represents a game unit entity with advanced capabilities including abilities, inventories, vitals, and level progression.
member.remarks: Unit extends the base Entity class to provide game-specific functionality such as: - Ability system integration for spells and skills - Inventory management for items and equipment - Vital properties like health and mana - Leveling and experience systems - State management for unit conditions - Combat and interaction capabilities This class serves as the foundation for characters, NPCs, creatures, and other interactive game objects.

member.name: P:GameCore.EntitySystem.Unit.ModSeed
member.summary: Gets or sets the modification seed used for random generation and procedural content.
member.remarks: This value is used to ensure consistent random generation for unit properties and behaviors. On the server, it's automatically generated; on the client, it's synchronized from the server.

member.name: P:GameCore.EntitySystem.Unit.GameCore#BaseInterface#ITarget#Unit
member.summary: Gets this unit as a target interface implementation.

member.name: P:GameCore.EntitySystem.Unit.ShouldIgnoreDamage
member.summary: Gets a value indicating whether this unit should ignore incoming damage.
member.remarks: Units ignore damage when they are dead or when the base entity has damage immunity.

member.name: P:GameCore.EntitySystem.Unit.InteractRadius
member.summary: Gets the radius within which other entities can interact with this unit.

member.name: M:GameCore.EntitySystem.Unit.#ctor(GameData.IGameLink{GameCore.EntitySystem.Data.GameDataUnit},GameCore.PlayerAndUsers.Player,GameCore.SceneSystem.ScenePoint,GameCore.BaseType.Angle)
member.summary: Initializes a new unit with the specified data link, owner, position, and facing direction.
member.param: The game data link defining this unit's properties and capabilities.
The player that owns this unit.
The initial position of the unit in the scene.
The initial facing direction of the unit.
member.exception: Thrown when the provided link has invalid data.
member.remarks: This constructor sets up all unit systems including components, abilities, inventories, vitals, and states based on the configuration defined in the unit's game data.

member.name: P:GameCore.EntitySystem.Unit.CanReceiveCommandRequest
member.summary: Gets a value indicating whether this unit can receive command requests from players or AI.
member.remarks: Units cannot receive commands when they have the UnCommandable state or when the base entity cannot receive commands.

member.name: M:GameCore.EntitySystem.Unit.GetFilterTags(GameCore.EntitySystem.Entity,System.Collections.Generic.HashSet{GameCore.BaseType.UnitFilterTag}@)
member.summary: Populates the provided tag set with filter tags that apply to this unit from the perspective of the given caster.
member.param: The entity requesting the filter information.
The set to populate with applicable filter tags.
member.remarks: This method combines static filters from the unit's configuration with dynamic filters based on current states. The tags are used for targeting, abilities, and other game systems that need to filter or categorize units.

member.name: M:GameCore.EntitySystem.Unit.ToString
member.summary: Returns a string representation of this unit including its type and friendly name.
member.returns: A formatted string describing this unit.

member.name: M:GameCore.EntitySystem.Unit.Dispose(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Performs cleanup of unit-specific resources during disposal.

member.name: T:GameCore.Event.EventEntityRemove
member.summary: Represents an event that occurs when an entity is removed from the system. For client-side, this event is triggered when the entity is no longer visible to the player. So the timing of this event may differ between server and client.
member.param: The entity that has been removed.

member.name: M:GameCore.Event.EventEntityRemove.#ctor(GameCore.EntitySystem.Entity)
member.summary: Represents an event that occurs when an entity is removed from the system. For client-side, this event is triggered when the entity is no longer visible to the player. So the timing of this event may differ between server and client.
member.param: The entity that has been removed.

member.name: T:GameCore.Event.EventGameStart
member.summary: Represents an event that is triggered when the game starts.
member.remarks: This event is fired once during game initialization after all systems have been set up and the game is ready to begin. It can be used to perform startup actions or initialize game-specific logic.

member.name: T:GameCore.Event.EventGameTick

member.name: P:GameCore.Execution.Data.GameDataEffect.TargetType
member.summary: 指定效果节点的目标类型，决定效果创建后的位置类型和视觉表现的播放行为。

remarks.para: 此属性是效果系统中最重要的配置之一，它不仅影响目标解析，更关键的是决定了 效果节点附带的视觉表现（）如何播放和跟随。

list.item: ：接受目标的天然类型，保持原始目标类型
：强制要求目标为单位实体，若目标为点会导致整个效果执行失败
：强制转换为坐标点，从单位目标提取执行瞬间的位置作为效果的执行目标
Unit类型：表现会跟随目标单位移动，适用于需要附着在单位身上的效果
Point类型：表现固定在指定坐标播放，适用于地面效果或固定位置特效
AOE场景：即使搜索逻辑相同，不同的TargetType会导致完全不同的表现播放位置

remarks.para: 火球术AOE爆炸效果：

list.item: TargetType = Unit：爆炸特效跟随目标单位移动，适合"附身爆炸"效果
TargetType = Point：爆炸特效固定在击中点，适合"地面爆炸"效果

remarks.para: ⚠️ 常见误区：开发者常认为瞬间效果的TargetType不重要，但实际上它显著影响视觉表现的播放方式。
某些效果类型由于业务语义的天然限制，只能作用于单位实体，不能将TargetType设置为Point：

list.item: ：伤害只能施加给单位，不能伤害坐标点
/：Buff状态只能附加到单位身上
GameDataEffectUnitMoverApply/Remove：移动器只能控制单位的移动
GameDataEffectUnitModify系列：只能修改单位的属性、朝向、归属等
GameDataEffectAbilityModify系列：只能修改单位拥有的技能

remarks.para: 这些效果通常继承自基类，默认TargetType为Unit。 如果错误地设置为Point，会导致效果执行时因为CmdError.MustTargetEntity而失败。

member.name: P:GameCore.Execution.Data.GameDataEffectAbility.AbilityLink
member.summary: If null, use the ability that triggered the effect.

member.name: T:GameCore.Execution.Data.GameDataEffectCreateUnit
member.summary: 创建单位效果的游戏数据配置，用于在指定位置生成新的游戏单位

remarks.para: GameDataEffectCreateUnit 是效果系统中用于创建单位的核心组件。它支持多种单位选择方式、 灵活的生成位置配置、所有权管理以及生成后的效果处理。

item.description: UnitLink - 通过 根据等级选择单位类型
Location - 通过 从目标位置获取单位类型
支持批量生成多个单位（）
可自定义生成位置偏移（）
灵活的单位所有权配置（）
可选的生成后效果处理（）
可选的默认AI配置（）

remarks.para: 系统会在执行前验证单位类型的有效性、玩家所有权的合法性等，确保创建过程的安全性和正确性。

member.name: P:GameCore.Execution.Data.GameDataEffectCreateUnit.UnitPicker
member.summary: 获取或设置单位选择方式，决定如何确定要创建的单位类型

remarks.para: 单位选择方式决定了系统如何确定要创建的单位类型：

item.description: UnitLink - 使用 根据效果等级选择单位
Location - 使用 从目标位置动态获取单位类型

remarks.para: UnitLink 方式适用于固定的单位类型配置，支持等级分层；Location 方式适用于需要根据 目标位置动态决定单位类型的场景，如复制目标位置的单位。

member.name: P:GameCore.Execution.Data.GameDataEffectCreateUnit.SpawnUnitTypePerLevel
member.summary: 获取或设置按等级分层的单位类型配置，当 为 UnitLink 时使用
member.value: 默认为空集合

remarks.para: 该属性允许根据效果的等级选择不同的单位类型，实现单位的升级机制。 系统会根据效果的当前等级查找对应的单位类型，使用 方法 进行自动等级范围限制，确保总是返回有效的单位类型。

item.description: 等级索引从0开始（等级0、1、2...）
建议从等级0开始配置，确保低等级效果有对应的单位类型
使用集合初始化语法按顺序添加单位类型
如果请求的等级超出范围，会自动返回最高等级的配置
如果集合为空，验证阶段会返回 InvalidUnitType 错误

example.code: SpawnUnitTypePerLevel = [ basicSoldierLink, // 等级0使用基础士兵 basicSoldierLink, // 等级1使用基础士兵 eliteSoldierLink, // 等级2使用精英士兵 eliteSoldierLink, // 等级3使用精英士兵 championSoldierLink // 等级4+使用冠军士兵（实际等级超出配置范围会返回配置中最高等级的单位类型） ];

member.name: P:GameCore.Execution.Data.GameDataEffectCreateUnit.SpawnTypeUnit
member.summary: 获取或设置目标位置表达式，当 为 Location 时用于动态获取单位类型

remarks.para: 该属性用于从指定的目标位置动态获取单位类型，常用于复制或转换现有单位的场景。 表达式会在运行时解析，从目标位置的实体中提取单位类型信息。

item.description: 复制目标单位：创建与目标相同类型的单位
单位转换：基于目标单位类型创建相关的其他单位
动态召唤：根据战场情况动态选择单位类型

remarks.para: 如果目标位置没有有效的单位或实体，验证阶段会返回 InvalidUnitType 错误。

member.name: P:GameCore.Execution.Data.GameDataEffectCreateUnit.SpawnOffset
member.summary: 获取或设置生成位置的偏移表达式，用于调整单位的实际生成位置
member.value: 默认为 ，表示不应用偏移

remarks.para: 该属性允许对基础生成位置应用偏移，实现更精确的位置控制。偏移会在效果的目标位置基础上计算， 支持固定偏移、随机偏移、以及基于效果上下文的动态偏移。

item.description: 固定偏移 - 相对于目标位置的固定距离和方向
随机偏移 - 在指定范围内随机选择偏移位置
动态偏移 - 基于效果上下文计算的偏移

remarks.para: 当值为 时，单位将直接在效果的目标位置生成。 偏移计算会考虑地形限制和碰撞检测，确保生成位置的有效性。

member.name: P:GameCore.Execution.Data.GameDataEffectCreateUnit.SpawnCount
member.summary: 获取或设置生成单位数量的计算函数
member.value: 默认为返回1的静态函数

remarks.para: 该函数用于动态计算要生成的单位数量，支持基于效果上下文的复杂逻辑。 函数接收当前效果实例作为参数，返回要生成的单位数量。

item.description: 固定数量 - 返回固定值的静态函数
等级相关 - 基于效果等级计算数量
属性相关 - 基于施法者属性计算数量
随机数量 - 在指定范围内随机选择数量

remarks.para: 返回值必须大于0，否则不会生成任何单位。建议对返回值进行合理的上限限制， 避免一次性生成过多单位影响游戏性能。

member.name: P:GameCore.Execution.Data.GameDataEffectCreateUnit.SpawnOwner
member.summary: 获取或设置生成单位的所有者表达式，决定新创建单位的归属
member.value: 默认为目标位置的施法者

remarks.para: 该表达式用于确定新创建单位的所有者（玩家），这直接影响单位的控制权、 敌友关系判定、以及相关的游戏逻辑。所有者的正确设置对于游戏平衡和逻辑正确性至关重要。

item.description: Caster - 效果施法者，最常见的配置
Target - 效果目标，用于"策反"类技能
Neutral - 中立单位，不属于任何玩家
Custom - 基于复杂逻辑确定的自定义所有者

remarks.para: 默认配置将单位所有者设置为效果施法者，这适用于大多数召唤类技能。 如果表达式解析失败或返回无效玩家，验证阶段会返回 InvalidPlayer 错误。

member.name: P:GameCore.Execution.Data.GameDataEffectCreateUnit.SpawnEffect
member.summary: 获取或设置在单位创建后立即执行的效果
member.value: 默认为 ，表示不执行额外效果

remarks.para: 该属性允许在单位成功创建后立即对其执行额外的效果，常用于初始化新单位的状态、 应用特殊属性、或触发相关的游戏事件。

item.description: 状态初始化 - 为新单位添加Buff或特殊状态
属性调整 - 修改新单位的基础属性
视觉效果 - 播放生成动画或特效
事件触发 - 触发与单位创建相关的游戏事件

remarks.para: 该效果会以新创建的单位作为目标执行，可以通过 将新单位存储到局部变量中供后续效果使用。如果生成效果执行失败，不会影响单位的创建。
当值为 时，跳过生成后效果的执行。

member.name: P:GameCore.Execution.Data.GameDataEffectCreateUnit.ImpactUnitLocVar
member.summary: 获取或设置用于存储新创建单位的局部变量类型
member.value: 默认为 ，表示不存储到局部变量

remarks.para: 该属性用于将新创建的单位存储到指定的局部变量中，使得后续的效果或逻辑 可以引用这些新创建的单位。这对于需要对创建的单位进行进一步操作的复杂效果非常有用。

item.description: 链式效果 - 后续效果需要引用新创建的单位
条件判断 - 基于创建的单位数量或类型执行不同逻辑
状态跟踪 - 在效果持续期间跟踪创建的单位
清理机制 - 在特定条件下清理或移除创建的单位

remarks.para: 当创建多个单位时，所有创建的单位都会存储到同一个局部变量中。 局部变量的生命周期与效果的执行上下文相关。
当值为 时，不会将单位存储到任何局部变量中。

member.name: P:GameCore.Execution.Data.GameDataEffectCreateUnit.Flags
member.summary: 获取或设置单位创建的标志配置，控制创建过程的特殊行为
member.value: 默认为新的 CreateUnitFlags 实例

remarks.para: 该属性包含控制单位创建过程特殊行为的标志配置。通过这些标志， 可以精确控制新创建单位的初始状态和行为模式。

item.description: UseDefaultAI - 是否为新创建的单位自动添加默认AI

remarks.para: UseDefaultAI 标志决定新创建的单位是否会自动获得默认的AI行为。 启用此标志适用于需要单位立即开始自主行动的场景，如召唤的盟友单位。 禁用此标志适用于需要玩家手动控制或有特殊AI配置的单位。

member.name: T:GameCore.Execution.Data.GameDataEffectSet
member.summary: 效果集合数据配置，用于将多个子效果组合成一个复合效果
member.remarks:
GameDataEffectSet 是效果系统中的核心组件，允许将多个子效果组合在一起执行。 它提供了灵活的执行控制，包括执行数量限制、随机选择、唯一性控制等功能。
效果集合支持两种主要的执行模式： - 顺序执行：按配置顺序依次执行子效果 - 随机执行：使用加权随机算法选择子效果执行
通过 可以精确控制执行行为，实现复杂的游戏机制， 如多重攻击、随机技能选择、连锁效果等。

member.name: P:GameCore.Execution.Data.GameDataEffectSet.Effects
member.summary: 获取或设置子效果列表，支持加权随机选择
member.remarks:
此属性定义了效果集合可以执行的子效果列表。每个子效果都有一个权重值， 当 为 时， 系统会根据权重进行随机选择。
权重值越高，被选中的概率越大。权重为0的效果永远不会被选中。

member.name: P:GameCore.Execution.Data.GameDataEffectSet.SetFlags
member.summary: 获取或设置效果集合的执行标志，控制执行行为
member.remarks: SetFlags 控制效果集合的执行方式，包括随机性、唯一性、源覆盖和验证等行为。 这些标志的组合可以实现各种复杂的执行模式。

member.name: P:GameCore.Execution.Data.GameDataEffectSet.MinCount
member.summary: 获取或设置最小执行效果数量
member.remarks:
此属性定义了效果集合必须执行的最少子效果数量。 如果设置为 ，则默认为0。
当 为 时， 如果可用的不重复子效果数量少于 MinCount，效果集合会执行失败。
此属性支持动态计算，可以通过表达式或函数返回不同的值。

member.name: P:GameCore.Execution.Data.GameDataEffectSet.MaxCount
member.summary: 获取或设置最大执行效果数量
member.remarks:
此属性定义了效果集合最多可以执行的子效果数量。 如果设置为 ，则根据 和 的值决定行为： - 当 Unique 或 PreferUnique 为 时，最大数量为可用效果数量 - 当两者都为 时，必须设置此属性，此时的语义为可以重复执行相同的子效果， 因此MaxCount的值必须有意义，否则就会陷入死循环。
此属性支持动态计算，可以通过表达式或函数返回不同的值。

member.name: M:GameCore.Execution.Data.GameDataEffectSet.CreateEffect(GameCore.BaseInterface.ITarget,GameCore.Interface.IExecutionContext,System.Boolean)
member.summary: 创建效果集合的执行实例
member.param: 默认目标
创建上下文
是否仅用于预验证
member.returns: 新创建的 EffectSet 实例
member.remarks: 此方法创建效果集合的执行实例，用于实际执行效果。 当 preValidateOnly 为 时，创建的实例仅用于验证， 不会执行实际的效果逻辑。

member.name: M:GameCore.Execution.Data.GameDataEffectSet.Execute(GameCore.Execution.Effect)
member.summary: 执行效果集合
member.param: 效果执行上下文
member.remarks:
此方法实现了效果集合的核心执行逻辑，根据配置的标志和参数执行子效果。
执行流程： 1. 如果启用了 ，将目标设置为源 2. 根据 决定执行模式 3. 根据 和 控制重复性 4. 执行选定数量的子效果
执行模式： - 顺序执行：按配置顺序依次执行，直到达到执行数量限制 - 随机执行：使用加权随机选择，支持唯一性控制

member.name: M:GameCore.Execution.Data.GameDataEffectSet.Validate(GameCore.Execution.Effect)
member.summary: 验证效果集合的配置有效性
member.param: 效果验证上下文
member.returns: 验证结果
member.remarks:
此方法验证效果集合的配置是否有效，包括： - 最小和最大执行数量的合理性 - 子效果数量的充足性 - 子效果的有效性（当启用验证时）
验证规则： 1. MinCount 不能大于 MaxCount 2. 当 Unique 和 PreferUnique 都为 false 时，MaxCount 不能为 null 3. 当 Unique 为 true 时，可用效果数量不能少于 MinCount 4. 当启用子效果验证时，有效子效果数量必须满足要求

member.name: T:GameCore.Execution.Data.Struct.SetFlags
member.summary: 定义效果集合的执行标志，控制效果集合的执行行为和特性
member.remarks: SetFlags 类用于配置效果集合（）的执行方式，包括随机性、唯一性、 源覆盖和子效果验证等行为。这些标志决定了效果集合如何从子效果列表中选择和执行效果， 为创建复杂的效果组合提供了灵活的控制选项。

member.name: P:GameCore.Execution.Data.Struct.SetFlags.WeightedRandom
member.summary: 获取或设置是否使用加权随机选择子效果
member.remarks:
当设置为 时，效果集合会使用加权随机算法从子效果列表中选择效果执行。 当设置为 时，效果集合会按顺序执行子效果。 默认值为 。
此标志与 和 配合使用， 可以实现复杂的随机选择逻辑。

member.name: P:GameCore.Execution.Data.Struct.SetFlags.PreferUnique
member.summary: 获取或设置是否优先选择不重复的子效果
member.remarks:
当设置为 时，效果集合会优先选择尚未执行过的子效果。 当设置为 时，效果集合不会考虑重复性。 默认值为 。
此标志与 配合使用时，可以实现"尽量不重复"的随机选择。 当所有子效果都已执行过时，系统会重新开始选择。

member.name: P:GameCore.Execution.Data.Struct.SetFlags.Unique
member.summary: 获取或设置是否严格禁止重复执行子效果
member.remarks:
当设置为 时，效果集合严格禁止重复执行同一个子效果。 当设置为 时，允许重复执行子效果。 默认值为 。
此标志比 更严格，当设置为 时， 如果可用的不重复子效果数量少于 ， 效果集合会执行失败。

member.name: P:GameCore.Execution.Data.Struct.SetFlags.OverrideSource
member.summary: 获取或设置是否将目标作为源传递给子效果
member.remarks:
当设置为 时，效果集合会将当前目标设置为子效果的源。 当设置为 时，子效果会继承父效果的源。 默认值为 。
此标志用于创建"连锁反应"类型的效果，其中每个子效果的目标成为下一个效果的源。 常用于闪电链、弹射效果等场景。

member.name: P:GameCore.Execution.Data.Struct.SetFlags.ValidateChildren
member.summary: 获取或设置是否在执行前验证子效果
member.remarks:
当设置为 时，效果集合会在执行前验证每个子效果的有效性。 当设置为 时，跳过子效果验证。 默认值为 。
启用此标志后，只有通过验证的子效果才会计入执行次数，但会增加性能开销。 当 为 时，此标志特别重要， 因为系统需要确保有足够的有效子效果来满足最小执行数量要求。

member.summary: I can just use IExecutionContext as shared parameter for all effects, but most IExecutionContext are disposable and I don't want to dispose them. I also want to snapshot context data, like unit properties, Level, etc.

member.name: P:GameCore.Execution.ExecutionParamShared.Level
member.summary: Snapped level of the execution

member.name: T:GameCore.Execution.ExecutionState
member.summary: Defines the possible states of execution for game operations, abilities, commands, or other executable actions.
member.remarks: This enum tracks the lifecycle of executable operations from initial queuing through completion or failure. It provides a standardized way to monitor and respond to the progress of various game systems that perform time-based or conditional operations.

member.name: F:GameCore.Execution.ExecutionState.Pending
member.summary: The execution is queued and waiting to begin.
member.remarks: This is the initial state when an operation has been requested but not yet started. The operation may be waiting for conditions to be met or for its turn in a queue.

member.name: F:GameCore.Execution.ExecutionState.Failed
member.summary: The execution has failed and cannot be completed.
member.remarks: This state indicates that the operation encountered an error, failed validation, or was unable to complete due to invalid conditions or constraints.

member.name: F:GameCore.Execution.ExecutionState.Executing
member.summary: The execution is currently in progress.
member.remarks: This state indicates that the operation has started and is actively being processed. The operation may still be running, animating, or performing its intended actions.

member.name: F:GameCore.Execution.ExecutionState.Aborted
member.summary: The execution was cancelled or interrupted before completion.
member.remarks: This state indicates that the operation was stopped by external intervention, such as user cancellation, conflicting operations, or changing game conditions.

member.name: F:GameCore.Execution.ExecutionState.Completed
member.summary: The execution has finished successfully.
member.remarks: This state indicates that the operation has run to completion and achieved its intended result without errors or interruptions.

member.name: T:GameCore.Extension.EnumExtensionAttribute
member.summary: Attribute used to mark enums for extension capabilities within the GameCore framework.
member.remarks: This attribute provides metadata for enums that can be extended at runtime or compile-time, allowing for flexible and modular enum systems. It supports flag-based enums, extendable enums that can be inherited, and enum extension hierarchies.

member.name: P:GameCore.Extension.EnumExtensionAttribute.UseAsFlags
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether the enum should be treated as a flags enumeration.
member.remarks: When set to true, the enum values can be combined using bitwise operations, similar to the standard behavior.

member.name: P:GameCore.Extension.EnumExtensionAttribute.Extendable
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether this enum can be extended by other enums.
member.remarks: Extendable enums can have additional values added through the extension system, allowing for modular and plugin-based enum definitions.

member.name: P:GameCore.Extension.EnumExtensionAttribute.Extends
member.summary: Gets or sets the base enum type that this enum extends.
member.remarks: When specified, this enum will inherit or extend the values from the base enum type, creating a hierarchical enum extension system.

member.name: T:GameCore.Extension.EnumValueExtensionAttribute
member.summary: Marks an enum field with extension configuration options, controlling its behavior in various game systems.
member.remarks: This attribute provides metadata for enum values that can be used by the game engine and editor tools to customize how specific enum values are handled, displayed, or processed. It allows fine-grained control over enum value behavior without modifying the core enum definition.

member.name: F:GameCore.Extension.EnumValueExtensionAttribute.HiddenInEditor
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether this enum value should be hidden in editor interfaces.
member.remarks: When set to true, this enum value will not appear in editor dropdowns, property inspectors, or other UI elements where enum values are displayed for selection. This is useful for internal or deprecated enum values that should not be exposed to content creators. TODO: Hide in Editor

member.name: M:GameCore.Extension.ExtensionMethods.As``1(System.Enum)
member.typeparam: the extendable enum type to check
member.param: the inner enum used for check

member.name: M:GameCore.Extension.ExtensionMethods.Except``1(``0,``0)
member.summary: Returns a new flag enum value with the specified flags removed.
member.param: The original enum value.
The flags to remove from the original value.
member.returns: A new enum value with the specified flags removed.
member.remarks: This method performs a bitwise AND operation with the bitwise NOT of the except parameter, effectively removing the specified flags from the original value. Example: RoutedEvents.All.Except(RoutedEvents.PointerClicked)

member.name: M:GameCore.Extension.ExtensionMethods.Forget(System.Threading.Tasks.Task,System.Action{System.Exception})
member.summary: 执行但不等待
member.remarks:
执行一个异步任务，但不等待。但依然可以捕获异常。
可以自定义异常处理，若没有设置，则异常会转到中。
member.param:
自定义异常处理，当任务中出现异常时会执行对应的处理逻辑。
若没有设置，则异常会转到中。

member.name: M:GameCore.Extension.ExtensionMethods.LogError(Microsoft.Extensions.Logging.ILogger,System.Exception,System.Diagnostics.StackTrace,System.String,System.Object[])
member.summary: Formats and writes an error log message.
member.param: The to write to.
The stack trace of the caller.
The exception to log.
Format string of the log message in message template format. Example: "User {User} logged in from {Address}".
An object array that contains zero or more objects to format.

example.code: logger.LogError(exception, new StackTrace(), "Error while processing request from {Address}", address)

member.name: T:GameCore.Extension.GameDataCategoryAttribute
member.summary: Marks a class as a game data category, indicating that it represents a configuration data type used by the game engine.
member.remarks: This attribute is used to identify classes that contain game configuration data, allowing the engine to automatically discover, load, and manage these data types. Classes marked with this attribute are typically used for defining game rules, unit properties, abilities, items, and other configurable game elements that can be modified without recompiling the game code.

member.name: T:GameCore.FloatingTextSystem.Data.GameDataFloatingText
member.summary: TODO: Does not have any data for now. The game actually uses FloatingText setting in the ini file. Should use GameDataFloatingText in the future.

member.name: P:GameCore.GameSystem.Data.GameDataGameMode.DefaultScene
member.summary: The default scene for this game mode. The server will try to load this scene when the game starts, and all players will be set to this scene by default.

member.name: T:GameCore.GameSystem.Data.GameDataGameplay
member.summary: 定义游戏核心玩法规则和全局配置，包含游戏运行时的关键参数和系统配置。
member.remarks: 此类作为游戏玩法的中央配置中心，包含影响整个游戏体验的全局设置。 通过此配置类可以统一管理各种游戏系统的默认行为和规则参数。

member.name: P:GameCore.GameSystem.Data.GameDataGameplay.DefaultWaveAI
member.summary: 获取或设置默认的波次AI配置，用于控制游戏中敌方单位的自动行为模式。
member.remarks: 此配置定义了游戏中AI单位的默认决策逻辑，包括移动模式、攻击策略、编队行为等。 所有未明确指定AI配置的敌方单位将使用此默认配置。

member.name: P:GameCore.GameSystem.Data.GameDataGameplay.ItemQualityList
member.summary: 获取或设置全局物品品质配置列表，定义游戏中所有品质等级的视觉表现和特效规则。

remarks.para: 此列表按品质等级顺序排列，物品的值用作索引来查找对应的品质配置：

item.description: = 0：使用列表中第一个品质配置（索引0）
= 1：使用列表中第二个品质配置（索引1），以此类推
如果超出列表范围，则使用最后一个品质配置
如果列表为空或null，物品将不应用任何品质相关的视觉效果

remarks.para: 品质配置影响物品在UI中的显示效果、地面掉落时的特效表现等视觉元素， 是实现物品稀有度系统的核心配置。建议按从低到高的品质顺序排列配置项。

member.name: T:GameCore.GameSystem.Data.GameDataGlobalConfig
member.summary: Represents the global configuration for game data, including available game modes and testing settings.
member.remarks: This class provides a centralized configuration for managing game modes and testing parameters. It includes a dictionary of available game modes, a default game mode for testing, and settings for single-player testing.

member.name: P:GameCore.GameSystem.Data.GameDataGlobalConfig.AvailableGameModes
member.summary: Register the game mod for the game system. in non-testing (online) mode, the server will send game mode strings to the engine, and the engine will use this to determine which game mode to use.

member.name: P:GameCore.GameSystem.Data.GameDataGlobalConfig.TestGameMode
member.summary: The game mode to use when testing the game remotely or locally.

member.name: P:GameCore.GameSystem.Data.GameDataGlobalConfig.SinglePlayerTestSlotId
member.summary: The player slot ID the local player will use in single-player testing mode.

member.name: T:GameCore.GameSystem.Data.GameDataRule
member.summary: Represents the abstract base class for all game rule configurations, defining how game systems behave and interact.
member.remarks: This class serves as the foundation for all rule-based game logic, including victory conditions, gameplay mechanics, resource management rules, and behavioral constraints. Derived classes implement specific rule types that govern different aspects of gameplay, allowing for flexible and configurable game systems that can be modified without code changes.

member.name: T:GameCore.GameSystem.Enum.EStandardUIType
member.summary: 标准UI类型枚举，按照传统游戏UI渲染优先级排序 数值越小的元素渲染层级越低（越靠后），数值越大的元素渲染层级越高（越靠前）
member.remarks: 渲染优先级从低到高的分层逻辑： 1. 基础游戏控制层：摇杆、地图等基础交互元素 2. 信息面板层：背包、角色面板、任务等游戏信息界面 3. 系统功能层：设置、排行榜等系统级功能 4. 交互反馈层：聊天、对话等即时交互 5. 顶层通知层：通知、主菜单等最高优先级UI

member.name: F:GameCore.GameSystem.Enum.EStandardUIType.Reward
member.summary: 奖励选择面板 - 游戏中的升级/奖励选择界面，需要暂停游戏并强制选择
member.remarks: 类似《吸血鬼幸存者》等游戏中的升级选择面板，具有以下特点： - 模态交互，暂停游戏进行 - 阻止其他UI操作 - 要求玩家必须做出选择才能继续 - 优先级应高于一般UI但低于系统确认对话框

member.summary: 确认对话框 - 重要操作确认，需要最高优先级

member.name: F:GameCore.GameSystem.Enum.EStandardUIType.ErrorDialog
member.summary: 系统错误提示 - 错误信息显示，最高优先级

member.name: F:GameCore.GameSystem.Enum.EStandardUIType.Loading
member.summary: 加载界面 - 场景切换时的加载提示

member.name: P:GameCore.GameSystem.Enum.StandardUIType.ExpectedZIndex
member.summary: 获取当前标准UI类型的期望ZIndex值
member.returns: 根据当前游戏模式的UI配置计算得出的ZIndex值，如果无法获取配置则返回null

remarks.para: 此属性会自动从当前游戏模式的 配置中获取ZIndex值。
计算公式：ZIndex = BaseZIndex + (在渲染顺序数组中的索引 × ZIndexStep)
如果满足以下任一条件，将返回null：

list.item: 游戏模式未初始化
游戏模式数据为空
UI配置未设置
当前UI类型不在渲染顺序配置中

remarks.para: 建议在使用前检查返回值是否为null，并提供合适的默认值。

member.summary: 系统通知提示 - 重要信息通知

member.name: F:GameCore.GameSystem.Enum.StandardUIType.MainMenu
member.summary: 主菜单界面 - 最高优先级的模态界面

member.name: F:GameCore.GameSystem.Enum.StandardUIType.Minimap
member.summary: 小地图/雷达 - 局部区域导航，通常固定显示

member.name: F:GameCore.GameSystem.Enum.StandardUIType.Hotbar
member.summary: 快捷栏/技能栏 - 快速访问技能和物品

member.name: F:GameCore.GameSystem.Enum.StandardUIType.StatusBar
member.summary: 血条/状态栏 - 角色生命值、法力值等关键状态。 注意这是指 UI 中的血条/状态栏，而非实体组件中的血条（位于场景中）。

member.name: F:GameCore.GameSystem.Enum.StandardUIType.Shop
member.summary: 商店/交易界面 - 商品购买和交易

member.name: F:GameCore.GameSystem.Enum.StandardUIType.Party
member.summary: 团队/组队界面 - 多人游戏团队管理

member.name: F:GameCore.GameSystem.Enum.StandardUIType.Social
member.summary: 好友/社交面板 - 社交功能管理

member.name: F:GameCore.GameSystem.Enum.StandardUIType.Achievement
member.summary: 成就系统界面 - 成就展示和追踪

member.name: F:GameCore.GameSystem.Enum.StandardUIType.Tutorial
member.summary: 教程/引导界面 - 新手引导和帮助

member.name: F:GameCore.GameSystem.Enum.StandardUIType.Reward
member.summary: 奖励选择面板 - 游戏中的升级/奖励选择界面，需要暂停游戏并强制选择
member.remarks: 类似《吸血鬼幸存者》等游戏中的升级选择面板，具有以下特点： - 模态交互，暂停游戏进行 - 阻止其他UI操作 - 要求玩家必须做出选择才能继续 - 优先级应高于一般UI但低于系统确认对话框

member.name: F:GameCore.GameSystem.Enum.StandardUIType.ConfirmDialog
member.summary: 确认对话框 - 重要操作确认，需要最高优先级

member.name: F:GameCore.GameSystem.Enum.StandardUIType.ErrorDialog
member.summary: 系统错误提示 - 错误信息显示，最高优先级

member.name: F:GameCore.GameSystem.Enum.StandardUIType.Loading
member.summary: 加载界面 - 场景切换时的加载提示

member.name: P:GameCore.GameSystem.Game.ForgetRunCaptureCallerStackTrace
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether the caller's should be captured when a task is run and subsequently forgotten. Default value is .
member.remarks: This property can be used to control whether stack trace information is retained for diagnostic purposes when a task is executed and not awaited. Setting this to may improve performance by avoiding the overhead of capturing the stack trace, but will lose the information of the task's caller stack.

member.name: T:GameCore.GameSystem.Game.TaskUnhandledExceptionEventHandler
member.summary: Represents the method that will handle an unhandled exception thrown during the execution of a task.
member.remarks: This delegate is typically used to subscribe to events or callbacks that notify about unhandled exceptions in asynchronous task execution. Implementations of this delegate should handle the exception appropriately, such as logging the error or performing cleanup operations.
member.param: The instance that encountered the unhandled exception.
The that was thrown by the task.
The optional of the caller at the time the exception occurred, providing additional context for debugging. Only work if is true.

member.name: M:GameCore.GameSystem.Game.Delay(System.TimeSpan,System.Nullable{System.Threading.CancellationToken},System.Int32)
member.summary: Creates a new instance with the specified delay duration, optional cancellation token, and adjustment value.
member.param: The duration of the delay.
An optional that can be used to cancel the delay. If , the delay cannot be canceled.
An optional adjustment value, in milliseconds, to modify the delay duration. The final delay duration is calculated as plus .
member.returns: A new instance configured with the specified parameters.

An optional that can be used to cancel the delay. If , the delay cannot be canceled.
An optional adjustment value, in milliseconds, to modify the delay duration. The final delay duration is calculated as plus .
member.returns: A new instance configured with the specified parameters.

member.param: The duration of the delay to simulate.
An optional to cancel the delay.
An optional adjustment value, in milliseconds, to modify the delay duration.
member.returns: A instance configured to simulate real-time progression.

An optional to cancel the delay.
An optional adjustment value, in milliseconds, to modify the delay duration.
member.returns: A instance configured to simulate real-time progression.

member.summary: Pauses the game for the specified duration or indefinitely if no timeout is provided.
member.remarks: The pause duration is determined by the parameter, with a default behavior of pausing indefinitely.
member.param: An optional specifying the duration to pause the game. If , the game will pause indefinitely.

member.name: M:GameCore.GameSystem.Game.Resume

member.name: E:GameCore.GameSystem.Game.OnRegisterGameClasses

Requires manually unregistering the event. When the game starts, the events happens in the following order:

OnGameDataInitialization

OnGameInstanceInitialization
EventGameStart

member.name: E:GameCore.GameSystem.Game.OnCanLoadDefaultScene
member.summary: Occurs when the application determines that the default scene can be loaded.
member.remarks: This event is triggered to signal that the conditions for loading the default scene have been met. Subscribers can use this event to initiate actions related to loading the default scene.

member.name: T:GameCore.Interface.IDebugDraw
member.summary: Defines an interface for drawing debug shapes and text in the game scene. Implementations provide methods to visualize geometric primitives such as lines, circles, points, sectors, parallelograms, rectangles, and text for debugging purposes.

member.name: T:GameCore.Interface.IExecutableData
member.summary: Represents game data that can be executed within a specific context, such as abilities, spells, or items.
member.remarks: This interface extends to provide execution capabilities with validation. Implementers define specific logic for how the data should be executed and what validation rules apply.

member.summary: Executes the data's logic within the specified context.
member.param: The execution context containing information about the caster, targets, and environment.

member.summary: Validates whether the data can be executed in the given context.
member.param: The execution context to validate against.
member.returns: A indicating whether execution is valid.

member.name: P:GameCore.Interface.IExecutableData.Validators
member.summary: Gets the validator function used for additional validation checks, if any.

member.name: T:GameCore.Interface.IExecutableObject
member.summary: Represents an object that can execute game logic within a specific context, providing access to execution parameters and validation.
member.remarks: This interface combines and to create objects that can both hold execution state and be executed. It provides access to casters, targets, abilities, items, and scene information needed for complex game operations.

member.name: T:GameCore.ItemSystem.Data.GameDataItem
member.summary: Represents the base data class for item configurations, defining common properties and creation methods for all item types.
member.remarks: This abstract class provides the foundation for all item data types in the game, including display information, unit associations, quality and level settings, and filtering capabilities. It defines the common interface for creating item instances and their associated units in the game world.

member.name: P:GameCore.ItemSystem.Data.GameDataItem.DisplayName
member.summary: Gets or sets the localized display name for this item.
member.remarks: This name is shown to players in the user interface and supports localization for different languages and regions.

member.name: P:GameCore.ItemSystem.Data.GameDataItem.Description
member.summary: Gets or sets the localized description text for this item.
member.remarks: This description provides detailed information about the item's purpose, effects, and usage. It supports localization for different languages and regions.

member.name: P:GameCore.ItemSystem.Data.GameDataItem.Icon
member.summary: Gets or sets the icon used to represent this item in the user interface.
member.remarks: The icon provides a visual representation of the item for display in inventories, tooltips, and other UI elements.

member.name: P:GameCore.ItemSystem.Data.GameDataItem.Unit
member.summary: Gets or sets the unit data that defines the physical representation of this item in the game world.
member.remarks: Every item is associated with a unit that provides its 3D model, collision, animations, and other physical properties when the item exists as an object in the game world.

member.name: P:GameCore.ItemSystem.Data.GameDataItem.Quality
member.summary: Gets or sets the default quality level for items created from this data.
member.remarks: Quality represents the tier or rarity of the item, affecting its properties and value. Individual item instances can have their quality modified after creation.

member.name: P:GameCore.ItemSystem.Data.GameDataItem.Level
member.summary: Gets or sets the default level for items created from this data.
member.remarks: Level represents the upgrade tier or enhancement level of the item. Individual item instances can have their level modified after creation.

member.name: P:GameCore.ItemSystem.Data.GameDataItem.Filter
member.summary: Gets or sets the targeting filters that determine which entities can interact with this item.
member.remarks: These filters control pickup eligibility, usage restrictions, and other interaction rules based on entity properties, states, and other criteria.

member.name: M:GameCore.ItemSystem.Data.GameDataItem.CreateItem(GameCore.SceneSystem.ScenePoint,GameCore.PlayerAndUsers.Player)
member.summary: Creates an item instance at the specified location in the game world.
member.param: The scene position where the item should be created.
The player that will own the item, or null to use the default player.
member.returns: A new item instance attached to a unit at the specified location.
member.remarks: This method creates both the physical unit representation and the item component, providing a complete item that exists in the game world and can be interacted with.

member.name: M:GameCore.ItemSystem.Data.GameDataItem.CreateItemUnit(GameCore.SceneSystem.ScenePoint,GameCore.PlayerAndUsers.Player)
member.summary: Creates the unit that will represent this item in the game world.
member.param: The scene position where the unit should be created.
The player that will own the unit, or null to use the default player.
member.returns: A new unit instance configured according to this item's unit data.
member.exception: Thrown when the unit data is invalid or null.
member.remarks: This method creates the physical representation of the item as a unit in the game world, which provides 3D model, collision, and other physical properties.

member.name: P:GameCore.ItemSystem.Data.GameDataItemPickable.CanAbsorb
member.summary: Automatically absorb the stack of another item, only if the item is stackable

member.name: T:GameCore.ItemSystem.Data.GameDataItemQuality
member.summary: 定义物品品质的视觉表现和特效配置，包括颜色、图标装饰和地面特效等品质相关的显示属性。
member.remarks: 物品品质系统通过此配置类为不同品质等级的物品提供统一的视觉标识。品质配置影响物品在UI中的显示效果， 包括名称颜色、图标装饰以及物品掉落在地面时的视觉特效。高品质物品通常配置更加醒目的视觉效果以突出其稀有性。

member.name: P:GameCore.ItemSystem.Data.GameDataItemQuality.Color
member.summary: 获取或设置此品质对应的显示颜色，用于物品名称和相关UI元素的着色。
member.remarks: 此颜色将应用于物品名称文本、品质标识等UI元素，为玩家提供直观的品质识别。 通常低品质使用灰白色，高品质使用金色、紫色等醒目颜色。

member.name: P:GameCore.ItemSystem.Data.GameDataItemQuality.BackgroundImage
member.summary: 获取或设置此品质的背景装饰图标，用于物品图标的背景层显示。
member.remarks: 背景图标通常显示在物品图标的后方，为不同品质提供视觉区分。 可以是简单的色彩背景、纹理图案或装饰性边框等。

member.name: P:GameCore.ItemSystem.Data.GameDataItemQuality.BorderImage
member.summary: 获取或设置此品质的边框装饰图标，用于物品图标的边框层显示。
member.remarks: 边框图标显示在物品图标的最前层，通常用于突出显示高品质物品。 可以是发光效果、华丽边框或特殊形状的装饰框等。

member.name: P:GameCore.ItemSystem.Data.GameDataItemQuality.ActorArray
member.summary: 获取或设置物品掉落在地面时的附属视觉特效Actor列表，用于提供品质相关的地面显示效果。

remarks.para: 这些Actor通常包含粒子系统、光效、动画等视觉组件，在物品作为地面对象存在时自动激活。
不同品质的物品可以配置不同强度和样式的特效：

item.description: 普通品质：无特效或简单光点
稀有品质：彩色光环或闪烁效果
史诗品质：华丽光柱或旋转特效
传说品质：复杂粒子系统和动态光效

remarks.para: 这些特效有助于玩家在游戏世界中快速识别和定位高价值物品。

member.name: T:GameCore.ItemSystem.DynamicModification
member.summary: 动态修改项，每个物品上对于特定槽位类型+属性+子类型的组合是唯一的
member.remarks: DynamicModification表示通过代码动态添加到物品上的属性修改。 每个物品上对于特定槽位类型+属性+子类型的组合只能有一个修改值， 这确保了数据的一致性和同步的便利性。

member.name: T:GameCore.ItemSystem.DynamicModificationManager
member.summary: 动态修改管理器，管理物品的动态属性加成 每个槽位类型+属性+子类型的组合在物品上是唯一的
member.remarks: DynamicModificationManager负责管理通过代码动态添加到物品上的属性修改。 它确保每个槽位类型+属性+子类型的组合在物品上是唯一的，便于数据同步和云保存。 管理器会根据物品的当前槽位状态自动应用或移除相应的修改。 仅在服务端使用，客户端通过属性同步机制获取属性值。

member.name: T:GameCore.ItemSystem.IPickUpItem
member.summary: Defines an interface for items that can be picked up and added to inventories.
member.remarks: This interface provides the contract for items that support pickup interactions with inventory systems. It includes validation to check if pickup is possible and methods to perform the actual pickup operation. Range checking is handled separately by the calling systems, allowing this interface to focus on item-specific pickup logic and inventory compatibility.

member.name: M:GameCore.ItemSystem.IPickUpItem.CanPickUp(GameCore.Container.InventoryManager)
member.summary: Determines whether the item can be picked up by the specified inventory manager.
member.param: The inventory manager attempting to pick up the item.
member.returns: true if the item can be picked up; otherwise, false.
member.remarks: This method performs validation checks such as inventory space, item compatibility, and other pickup requirements. Range checking is explicitly ignored and should be handled by the calling system before invoking this method.

member.name: M:GameCore.ItemSystem.IPickUpItem.PickUp(GameCore.Container.InventoryManager,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Attempts to pick up the item and add it to the specified inventory manager.
member.param: The inventory manager that will receive the item.
Whether this is a request operation (for validation) or an actual pickup.
member.returns: true if the pickup was successful; otherwise, false.
member.remarks: This method performs the actual pickup operation, transferring the item to the inventory. Range checking is explicitly ignored and should be handled by the calling system. When is true, this may perform a dry-run validation without actually modifying the item or inventory state.

member.name: P:GameCore.ItemSystem.IPickUpItem.IsValid
member.summary: Gets a value indicating whether this item is still valid and can participate in pickup operations.
member.remarks: Invalid items (such as destroyed or disposed items) should not be available for pickup. This property allows the pickup system to filter out items that are no longer active.

member.name: T:GameCore.ItemSystem.Item
member.summary: Represents the base class for all items in the game, providing common functionality for quality, level, and category management.
member.remarks: Items are components attached to units that represent equipment, consumables, and other game objects. They support quality and level progression, categorization for filtering and organization, and integration with the property and event systems. Items can be synchronized between server and client for multiplayer functionality and participate in the cooldown system for ability-based items.

member.name: M:GameCore.ItemSystem.Item.ToString
member.summary: Returns a string representation of this item including its type and friendly name.
member.returns: A formatted string describing this item.

member.name: P:GameCore.ItemSystem.Item.Link
member.summary: Gets the game data link that defines this item's configuration and properties.

member.name: P:GameCore.ItemSystem.Item.Cache
member.summary: Gets the cached game data for this item, providing access to configuration properties.

member.name: M:GameCore.ItemSystem.Item.#ctor(GameCore.EntitySystem.Unit,GameData.IGameLink{GameCore.ItemSystem.Data.GameDataItem})
member.summary: Initializes a new item instance and attaches it to the specified unit.
member.param: The unit that will own this item.
The game data link defining this item's properties.
member.exception: Thrown when the provided link has invalid data.
member.remarks: This constructor sets up the item with its initial quality and level from the data configuration, configures synchronization settings, and registers the item with the host's attached objects system.

member.name: P:GameCore.ItemSystem.Item.Unit
member.summary: Gets the unit that owns this item.
member.remarks: Items are always attached to units, which serve as their hosts and provide context for item functionality and interactions.

member.name: P:GameCore.ItemSystem.Item.Quality
member.summary: Gets or sets the quality level of this item.
member.remarks: Quality represents the tier or rarity of the item, affecting its properties and value. Changes to quality trigger quality change events and are synchronized between server and client. On the client side, this property can only be set internally through replication.

member.name: P:GameCore.ItemSystem.Item.Level
member.summary: Gets or sets the level of this item.
member.remarks: Level represents the upgrade tier or enhancement level of the item, typically affecting its effectiveness and properties. Changes to level trigger level change events and are synchronized between server and client. On the client side, this property can only be set internally through replication.

member.name: P:GameCore.ItemSystem.Item.Categories
member.summary: Gets the list of categories this item belongs to.
member.remarks: Categories are used for filtering, organizing, and applying rules to items. They help determine compatibility with inventories, abilities, and other game systems.

member.name: M:GameCore.ItemSystem.Item.HasCategory(GameCore.Struct.ItemCategory)
member.summary: Determines whether this item belongs to the specified category.
member.param: The category to check for.
member.returns: true if the item has the specified category; otherwise, false.
member.remarks: This method provides a convenient way to check item compatibility and filtering rules based on category membership.

member.name: P:GameCore.ItemSystem.Item.QualityConfiguration
member.summary: 获取当前物品品质对应的配置数据，用于确定品质相关的视觉表现和特效。

remarks.para: 此属性根据物品的值从全局品质配置列表中查找对应的配置。
查找规则：

item.description: 使用值作为索引在中查找
如果索引超出范围，返回列表中的最后一个配置
如果全局配置列表为空或null，返回null（物品将不显示品质特效）

remarks.para: 此属性为只读计算属性，每次访问时动态获取最新的配置数据。

member.name: T:GameCore.ItemSystem.ItemExtension
member.summary: Provides extension methods for entity-based item component access.
member.remarks: This class enables exclusive access to item components on entities, allowing the use of Entity.GetComponent<Item>() syntax to retrieve item components by their tag.

member.name: M:GameCore.ItemSystem.ItemExtension.GetComponent``1(GameCore.EntitySystem.Entity)
member.summary: Gets an item component of the specified type from the entity.
member.typeparam: The type of item component to retrieve.
member.param: The entity to search for the item component.
member.returns: The item component if found; otherwise, null.
member.remarks: This extension method provides a convenient way to access item components on entities using generic type parameters and the standard component access pattern.

member.name: T:GameCore.ItemSystem.ItemMod
member.summary: Represents a modifier item that can be equipped and provides dynamic property modifications and abilities to the host unit.
member.remarks: ItemMod is an advanced item type that can grant abilities, modify unit properties, and provide dynamic effects based on the equipped slot and current game state. Unlike static items, ItemMods have complex requirements, stack-based effects, and can enable/disable themselves based on conditions. They integrate with the modification system to provide property bonuses and state changes, and can grant temporary abilities while equipped. The item can have different effects based on which slot type it's equipped in, supporting versatile equipment systems.

member.name: P:GameCore.ItemSystem.ItemMod.IsEnabled
member.summary: Gets a value indicating whether this item mod is currently enabled and providing its effects.
member.value: True if the item mod meets all requirements and is actively providing benefits; otherwise, false.
member.remarks: An enabled item mod actively applies its property modifications, state changes, and grants its ability. The enabled state depends on meeting all base requirements plus any additional item-specific requirements.

member.name: P:GameCore.ItemSystem.ItemMod.EffectCaster
member.summary: Gets the entity that serves as the caster for effects granted by this item mod.
member.value: The carrying unit if the item is being carried, otherwise the owning unit.
member.remarks: This property determines which entity is considered the source for abilities and effects granted by this item mod. It's important for targeting, ownership, and effect attribution.

member.name: P:GameCore.ItemSystem.ItemMod.MeetRequirement
member.summary: Gets a value indicating whether this item mod meets all requirements for activation.
member.value: True if all base and carrier-specific requirements are met; otherwise, false.
member.remarks: Item mods can have additional requirements beyond basic item requirements, such as unit level, stats, or other conditions that must be met by the carrying unit.

member.name: P:GameCore.ItemSystem.ItemMod.Stack
member.summary: Gets or sets the stack count for this item mod.
member.value: The number of identical item mods stacked together.
member.remarks: Stack count affects the magnitude of property modifications and other effects. When the stack count changes, all modifications are updated to reflect the new values.

member.name: M:GameCore.ItemSystem.ItemMod.#ctor(GameCore.EntitySystem.Unit,GameData.IGameLink{GameCore.ItemSystem.Data.GameDataItemMod},System.Boolean)
member.summary: Initializes a new item mod instance with the specified configuration.
member.param: The unit that will own this item mod.
The game data link defining this item mod's properties and effects.
Whether to immediately initialize modification managers for all slot types.
member.remarks: This constructor sets up modification managers for each slot type defined in the item's configuration. If initializeModificationData is true, all managers are immediately initialized; otherwise, they are created but not activated until needed.

member.name: P:GameCore.ItemSystem.ItemMod.DynamicModifications
member.summary: 动态修改管理器
member.remarks: 管理通过代码动态添加到物品上的属性修改。 每个槽位类型+属性+子类型的组合在物品上是唯一的。 仅在服务端使用，客户端通过属性同步机制获取属性值。

member.name: M:GameCore.ItemSystem.ItemMod.TestRequirement(GameCore.EntitySystem.Unit)
member.summary: Tests whether this item mod meets all requirements for the specified unit.
member.param: The unit to test requirements against.
member.returns: True if the unit meets all requirements for this item mod; otherwise, false.
member.remarks: This method checks both the base item requirements and any additional requirements specific to this item mod type, such as level, stats, or class restrictions.

member.name: P:GameCore.ItemSystem.ItemMod.ActiveAbility
member.summary: Gets the ability currently granted by this item mod, if any.
member.value: The active ability instance, or null if no ability is currently granted.
member.remarks: Item mods can grant temporary abilities while equipped. The ability is automatically created when the item mod is properly equipped and meets requirements, and destroyed when conditions change. On the client side, this property reflects the server state.

member.name: P:GameCore.ItemSystem.ItemMod.ActiveModificationManager
member.summary: Gets the modification manager currently active for this item mod based on its equipped slot.
member.value: The active modification manager, or null if the item is not equipped in a supported slot.
member.remarks: The active modification manager determines which set of property modifications and effects are currently being applied. This can change when the item is moved between different slots.

member.remarks: This method allows access to modification managers for specific slot types, which is useful for inspecting potential effects before equipping the item in different slots.

member.name: M:GameCore.ItemSystem.ItemMod.UpdateModifications(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Updates all modifications applied by this item mod based on current state.
member.param: When true, forces all modification data to be re-evaluated, used for item level changes or state updates.
member.remarks: This method refreshes the item mod's effects, including property modifications, state changes, and ability grants. It should be called whenever the item's context changes, such as when equipped, moved, or when the carrying unit's state changes. The forced parameter triggers a complete recalculation of all modification values.

member.name: P:GameCore.Leveling.Data.GameDataUnitLeveling.ExtraLevelExperienceRequiredLevelFactor
member.summary: If the targeting level is higher than the level specified in , this value and will be used to calculate the experience required for level n from n-1. The formula is: RequiredExperience = ExtraLevelExperienceRequiredLevelFactor * level + ExtraLevelExperienceRequiredBonusPerLevel

member.name: P:GameCore.Leveling.Data.GameDataUnitLeveling.ExtraLevelExperienceRequiredBonusPerLevel
member.summary: If the targeting level is higher than the level specified in , this value and will be used to calculate the experience required for level n from n-1. The formula is: RequiredExperience = ExtraLevelExperienceRequiredLevelFactor * level + ExtraLevelExperienceRequiredBonusPerLevel

member.name: P:GameCore.Leveling.Data.GameDataUnitLeveling.MaxLevelLeech
member.summary: Specifies if the entity can still be distributed experience even if it is at the maximum level. This is useful for entities that have a maximum level but can still gain experience for other purposes, such as item upgrades or other rewards. If this is set to false, the entity will not receive experience if it is at the maximum level, and other candidates will receive more experience as fewer candidates are available.

member.summary: Returns the experience required to reach the specified level from the previous level. For levels within ExperienceRequiredForEachLevel, returns the corresponding value. For higher levels, uses the formula: RequiredExperience = ExtraLevelExperienceRequiredLevelFactor * level + ExtraLevelExperienceRequiredBonusPerLevel
member.param: The target level.
member.returns: Experience required to reach the specified level from the previous level.

member.returns: Total experience required to reach the specified level from level 0.
