member.name: T:GameCore.TaskSystem.Task
member.summary: Represents an abstract base class for asynchronous tasks that can be executed, monitored, and cancelled within the game framework.
member.remarks: The Task class provides a foundation for implementing long-running operations that need to be executed over multiple game ticks. Unlike standard .NET tasks, these tasks are integrated with the game's tick system and provide cancellation support through cancellation tokens. Tasks can be started, stopped, and monitored through events. The class supports both synchronous and asynchronous stopping mechanisms depending on the allowSynchronousStop parameter.
member.param: Optional cancellation token to monitor for cancellation requests.
Whether the task can be stopped immediately or must wait for the next tick finalizer.

member.name: M:GameCore.TaskSystem.Task.#ctor(System.Nullable{System.Threading.CancellationToken},System.Boolean)
member.summary: Represents an abstract base class for asynchronous tasks that can be executed, monitored, and cancelled within the game framework.
member.remarks: The Task class provides a foundation for implementing long-running operations that need to be executed over multiple game ticks. Unlike standard .NET tasks, these tasks are integrated with the game's tick system and provide cancellation support through cancellation tokens. Tasks can be started, stopped, and monitored through events. The class supports both synchronous and asynchronous stopping mechanisms depending on the allowSynchronousStop parameter.
member.param: Optional cancellation token to monitor for cancellation requests.
Whether the task can be stopped immediately or must wait for the next tick finalizer.

member.name: P:GameCore.TaskSystem.Task.Status
member.summary: Gets the current status of the task.
member.value: The current task status indicating whether it's waiting, running, completed, or cancelled.
member.remarks: Setting the status triggers appropriate events (OnStarted, OnCompleted, OnStopped) and manages the task's lifecycle transitions. The status changes are monitored by the task system.

member.name: E:GameCore.TaskSystem.Task.OnStarted
member.summary: Occurs when the task starts running.
member.remarks: This event is raised when the task transitions from WaitingForActivation to Running status. Subscribers can use this event to perform initialization or logging when a task begins execution.

member.name: E:GameCore.TaskSystem.Task.OnStopped
member.summary: Occurs when the task stops running, regardless of whether it completed successfully or was cancelled.
member.remarks: This event is raised for both successful completion and cancellation scenarios. It's useful for cleanup operations that need to occur regardless of how the task ended.

member.name: E:GameCore.TaskSystem.Task.OnCompleted
member.summary: Occurs when the task completes successfully.
member.remarks: This event is raised only when the task finishes its work successfully (not when cancelled). It's raised before the OnStopped event for completed tasks.

member.name: M:GameCore.TaskSystem.Task.Start
member.summary: Starts the execution of the task.
member.remarks: This method transitions the task from WaitingForActivation to Running status. If a cancellation token was provided, it registers a callback to handle cancellation requests. The method has no effect if the task is not in the WaitingForActivation state.

member.name: M:GameCore.TaskSystem.Task.Cancel
member.summary: Cancels the task execution.
member.remarks: This is a convenience method that calls Stop(false) to cancel the task. The actual stopping behavior depends on the allowSynchronousStop parameter set during construction.

member.name: M:GameCore.TaskSystem.Task.Stop(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Stops the task execution, either due to completion or cancellation.
member.param: True if the task is stopping because it completed successfully; false for cancellation.
member.returns: True if the stop operation was initiated successfully; otherwise, false.
member.remarks: The behavior depends on the allowSynchronousStop setting. If synchronous stopping is allowed, the task stops immediately. Otherwise, the stop operation is deferred to the next tick finalizer for completed tasks, or marked as pending cancel for cancelled tasks.

member.name: M:GameCore.TaskSystem.Task.StopSynchronous(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Immediately stops the task and performs cleanup operations.
member.param: True if the task completed successfully; false if it was cancelled.
member.returns: True if the task was stopped successfully; otherwise, false.
member.remarks: This method performs the actual stopping logic including unregistering cancellation tokens, updating the status, and clearing event handlers. It's called either immediately (for synchronous stops) or during tick finalization (for asynchronous stops).

member.name: M:GameCore.TaskSystem.Task.TickFinalizer
member.summary: Finalizes the task state during the tick finalizer phase.
member.remarks: This method is called by the game's tick finalizer system to handle deferred task stopping. It checks for pending cancellation or cancellation token requests and performs the appropriate stopping action. For tasks that don't have pending cancellation, it assumes successful completion.

member.name: P:GameCore.TaskSystem.Task.IsCompleted
member.summary: Gets a value indicating whether the task has completed successfully.
member.value: True if the task status is RanToCompletion; otherwise, false.

member.name: P:GameCore.TaskSystem.Task.IsEnded
member.summary: Gets a value indicating whether the task has finished execution (either completed, cancelled, or faulted).
member.value: True if the task is in a terminal state; otherwise, false.
member.remarks: This property is useful for determining if a task is no longer active and can be cleaned up or removed from tracking collections.

member.name: M:GameCore.TaskSystem.TaskResult`1.#ctor(System.Threading.Tasks.TaskStatus)
member.summary: Constructor for error result
member.param: Can only pass values that are not TaskStatus.RanToCompletion

member.name: T:GameCore.Timers.Awaitable`1
member.summary: Represents an abstract awaitable task that can be used with async/await patterns while integrating with the game's thinking and tick systems.
member.typeparam: The type of result produced by this awaitable task.
member.remarks: This class bridges the gap between the game's tick-based execution model and C#'s async/await functionality. It provides a foundation for creating game-specific awaitable operations such as delays, animations, and other time-based tasks that need to execute over multiple game frames. The class implements both the game's IThinker interface for tick-based processing and the .NET INotifyCompletion interface for async/await support.
member.param: Optional cancellation token to monitor for cancellation requests.
Whether the task can be stopped immediately or must wait for the next tick finalizer.

member.name: M:GameCore.Timers.Awaitable`1.#ctor(System.Nullable{System.Threading.CancellationToken},System.Boolean)
member.summary: Represents an abstract awaitable task that can be used with async/await patterns while integrating with the game's thinking and tick systems.
member.typeparam: The type of result produced by this awaitable task.
member.remarks: This class bridges the gap between the game's tick-based execution model and C#'s async/await functionality. It provides a foundation for creating game-specific awaitable operations such as delays, animations, and other time-based tasks that need to execute over multiple game frames. The class implements both the game's IThinker interface for tick-based processing and the .NET INotifyCompletion interface for async/await support.
member.param: Optional cancellation token to monitor for cancellation requests.
Whether the task can be stopped immediately or must wait for the next tick finalizer.

member.name: M:GameCore.Timers.Awaitable`1.Start
member.summary: Starts the awaitable task and begins processing if necessary.
member.remarks: This method initiates the task execution and determines whether it needs to continue thinking on subsequent frames. If the task can complete immediately, it will be stopped synchronously or scheduled for finalization depending on the allowSynchronousStop setting.

member.name: M:GameCore.Timers.Awaitable`1.GetAwaiter
member.summary: Gets the awaiter for this awaitable task, enabling async/await syntax.
member.returns: This awaitable instance, which serves as its own awaiter.
member.remarks: This method is required for async/await support and allows the awaitable to be used directly in await expressions without requiring a separate awaiter object.

member.name: M:GameCore.Timers.Awaitable`1.GameCore#BaseInterface#IThinker#Think(System.Int32)
member.summary: Processes the thinking logic for this awaitable on each game tick.
member.param: The time delta since the last tick in milliseconds.
member.remarks: This method is called by the game's thinking system on each frame while the task is active. It delegates to the abstract ThinkAction method for specific processing and checks if the task should finish after each update.

member.name: M:GameCore.Timers.Awaitable`1.ThinkAction(System.Int32)
member.summary: Performs the specific thinking action for this awaitable task.
member.param: The time delta since the last tick in milliseconds.
member.remarks: This abstract method must be implemented by derived classes to define what happens during each tick while the awaitable is active. This is where the core logic for progress tracking, countdown timers, or other time-based operations should be implemented.

member.name: M:GameCore.Timers.Awaitable`1.ThinkFinish
member.summary: Determines whether this awaitable task should finish execution.
member.returns: True if the task should complete; otherwise, false to continue thinking.
member.remarks: This abstract method must be implemented by derived classes to define the completion condition for the awaitable. It's called after each ThinkAction to determine if the task has reached its completion criteria.

member.name: M:GameCore.Timers.Awaitable`1.GetResult
member.summary: Gets the result value of this awaitable task.
member.returns: The result produced by this awaitable task.
member.remarks: This abstract method must be implemented by derived classes to provide the final result of the awaitable operation. It's called when the async/await operation completes.

member.name: P:GameCore.Timers.Awaitable`1.Result
member.summary: Gets the result of the task, either the actual result if completed or the current status.
member.value: A TaskResult containing either the result value or the current task status.
member.remarks: This property provides a way to access the result without blocking. If the task is completed, it returns the actual result; otherwise, it returns the current task status.

member.name: M:GameCore.Timers.Awaitable`1.System#Runtime#CompilerServices#INotifyCompletion#OnCompleted(System.Action)
member.summary: Schedules a continuation action to be executed when the awaitable completes.
member.param: The action to execute upon completion.
member.remarks: This method is part of the INotifyCompletion interface and is used by the async/await infrastructure to schedule code that should run after the awaitable completes.

member.name: M:GameCore.Timers.Awaitable`1.Stop(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Stops the awaitable task and disables thinking.
member.param: True if the task is stopping because it completed successfully; false for cancellation.
member.returns: True if the stop operation was initiated successfully; otherwise, false.
member.remarks: This method extends the base Task stop behavior by also disabling the thinking process to prevent unnecessary tick processing after the task has been stopped.

member.name: M:GameCore.Timers.Awaitable`1.StopSynchronous(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Immediately stops the awaitable task, disables thinking, and executes any pending continuation.
member.param: True if the task completed successfully; false if it was cancelled.
member.returns: True if the task was stopped successfully; otherwise, false.
member.remarks: This method performs the actual stopping logic including disabling thinking, executing the continuation callback if the task completed successfully, and cleaning up resources.

member.name: T:GameCore.Timers.Delay
member.summary: Represents an awaitable delay that can be used to pause execution for a specified duration in game time or real time.
member.remarks: This class provides a way to create delays in game logic that can be adjusted based on frame timing. The delay can be paused, resumed, and configured to account for frame delta time variations. It integrates seamlessly with async/await patterns while working with the game's tick system.

member.name: P:GameCore.Timers.Delay.AdjustByFrameDelta
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether the delay should be adjusted based on the frame delta time.
member.value: True to adjust by frame delta time; false to use fixed frame duration.
member.remarks:
When set to false, the delay counts each game tick as a fixed duration based on .
When set to true, the delay is adjusted by the delta time of each frame, making it more accurate to real time.
However, setting this to true may cause jittery behavior if the frame rate is inconsistent.

example.code: var delay = new Delay(TimeSpan.FromSeconds(5)) { AdjustByFrameDelta = true };

member.name: M:GameCore.Timers.Delay.#ctor(System.TimeSpan,System.Nullable{System.Threading.CancellationToken},System.Int32,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the Delay class with a TimeSpan duration.
member.param: The duration to delay execution.
Optional cancellation token to monitor for cancellation requests.
Optional time adjustment in milliseconds to add to the delay duration.
Whether the delay can be stopped immediately or must wait for the next tick finalizer.
member.remarks: This constructor converts the TimeSpan to milliseconds and delegates to the milliseconds constructor. The delay starts immediately upon construction.

member.name: M:GameCore.Timers.Delay.#ctor(System.Int32,System.Nullable{System.Threading.CancellationToken},System.Int32,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the Delay class with a duration in milliseconds.
member.param: The duration to delay execution in milliseconds.
Optional cancellation token to monitor for cancellation requests.
Optional time adjustment in milliseconds to add to the delay duration.
Whether the delay can be stopped immediately or must wait for the next tick finalizer.
member.remarks: The delay starts immediately upon construction. The adjustment parameter can be used to fine-tune the delay duration, which is useful for synchronization or timing corrections.

member.name: M:GameCore.Timers.Delay.Pause(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Pauses or resumes the delay execution.
member.param: True to pause the delay; false to resume it.
member.remarks: When paused, the delay will stop counting down and remain at its current remaining time. This method has no effect if the delay has already completed. Pausing a delay effectively stops its thinking process until resumed.

member.name: M:GameCore.Timers.Delay.SetRemainingTime(System.TimeSpan)
member.summary: Sets the remaining time for the delay to a new value.
member.param: The new remaining time for the delay.
member.returns: True if the remaining time was successfully set; false if the delay has already completed.
member.remarks: This method allows you to modify the remaining time of an active delay, which can be useful for extending or shortening delays based on game events or conditions. The method has no effect if the delay has already completed.

member.name: M:GameCore.Timers.Delay.ThinkAction(System.Int32)
member.summary: Performs the delay countdown logic on each game tick.
member.param: The time delta since the last tick in milliseconds.
member.remarks: This method is called automatically by the thinking system. It decrements the remaining time either by the actual frame delta (if AdjustByFrameDelta is true) or by the fixed frame duration.

member.name: M:GameCore.Timers.Delay.ThinkFinish
member.summary: Determines whether the delay should finish execution.
member.returns: True if the delay time has elapsed; otherwise, false.
member.remarks: This method is called after each ThinkAction to determine if the delay has reached its completion condition (remaining time <= 0).

member.name: P:GameCore.Timers.Delay.RemainingTime
member.summary: Gets the remaining time before the delay completes.
member.value: A TimeSpan representing the remaining delay duration.
member.remarks: This property provides real-time access to how much time is left in the delay. Once the delay completes, this value will be zero or negative.

member.name: P:GameCore.Timers.Delay.Priority
member.summary: Gets the priority value used for scheduling this delay in the thinking system.
member.value: A priority value based on the remaining time modulo the frame duration, or null if not applicable.
member.remarks: This property is used internally by the game's scheduling system to optimize the order of delay processing. Lower values indicate higher priority.

member.name: M:GameCore.Timers.Delay.GetResult
member.summary: Gets the result value of the delay when it completes.
member.returns: The remaining time in milliseconds when the delay finished (typically zero or negative).
member.remarks: This method is called by the await mechanism when the delay completes. The returned value represents how much time was remaining when the delay finished, which can be useful for timing calculations or detecting early completion.

member.name: T:GameCore.Timers.DelayTill
member.summary: Represents an awaitable operation that waits until a specified condition becomes true.
member.remarks: This class provides a way to pause execution until a custom condition is satisfied. The condition is checked every game tick until it returns true. This is useful for waiting on game state changes, entity conditions, or other dynamic criteria.

member.name: M:GameCore.Timers.DelayTill.#ctor(System.Func{System.Boolean},System.Nullable{System.Threading.CancellationToken},System.Boolean)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class with the specified condition.
member.param: A function that returns true when the wait condition is satisfied.
An optional cancellation token to cancel the wait operation.
Whether the operation can complete synchronously if the condition is already true.
member.remarks: The condition function will be called every game tick until it returns true or the operation is cancelled.

member.name: M:GameCore.Timers.DelayTill.GetResult
member.summary: Gets the result of the conditional wait operation.
member.returns: Always returns true when the condition is satisfied.

member.name: M:GameCore.Timers.DelayTill.ThinkAction(System.Int32)
member.summary: Performs no action during each tick - the condition checking is handled in .
member.param: The time delta for this tick (unused).

member.name: M:GameCore.Timers.DelayTill.ThinkFinish
member.summary: Determines whether the conditional wait should finish by evaluating the condition.
member.returns: The result of the condition function.

member.name: T:GameCore.Timers.DelayTillWithTimeout
member.summary: Represents an awaitable operation that waits until a specified condition becomes true or a timeout expires.
member.remarks:
This class combines conditional waiting with timeout functionality. It will complete when either: - The specified condition returns true, or - The timeout period expires
The remaining time when the operation completes indicates whether the condition was met (positive value) or the timeout expired (zero or negative value). This is useful for operations that need to wait for game state changes but have a maximum wait time to prevent infinite blocking.

member.name: P:GameCore.Timers.DelayTillWithTimeout.AdjustByFrameDelta
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether the delay should be adjusted based on the frame delta time.

remarks.list:
- When set to false, the delay counts each game tick as a fixed duration based on .
- When set to true, the delay is adjusted by the delta time of each frame, making it more accurate to real time. However, this may cause jittery behavior if the frame rate is inconsistent.

example.code: var delay = new Delay(TimeSpan.FromSeconds(5)) { AdjustByFrameDelta = true };

member.name: M:GameCore.Timers.DelayTillWithTimeout.#ctor(System.Func{System.Boolean},System.TimeSpan,System.Nullable{System.Threading.CancellationToken},System.Int32,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class with the specified condition and timeout.
member.param: A function that returns true when the wait condition is satisfied.
The maximum time to wait before timing out.
An optional cancellation token to cancel the wait operation.
An optional adjustment value, in milliseconds, to modify the timeout duration.
Whether the operation can complete synchronously if the condition is already true.
member.remarks: The operation will complete when either the condition becomes true or the timeout expires. Use to determine which case occurred by checking if the remaining time is positive.

member.name: M:GameCore.Timers.DelayTillWithTimeout.ThinkFinish
member.summary: Determines whether the conditional wait with timeout should finish.
member.returns: true if the timeout has expired or the condition is satisfied; otherwise, false.

member.name: M:GameCore.Timers.DelayTillWithTimeout.ThinkAction(System.Int32)
member.summary: Updates the remaining time during each tick of the wait operation.
member.param: The time delta for this tick.
member.remarks: The time reduction depends on the setting.

member.name: M:GameCore.Timers.DelayTillWithTimeout.GetResult
member.summary: Gets the remaining time when the operation completes.
member.returns: The remaining time in milliseconds. A positive value indicates the condition was satisfied before timeout; zero or negative indicates the timeout expired.

member.name: T:GameCore.Timers.EventWaiter
member.summary: Represents an abstract base class for awaitable event waiters that can wait for specific events to occur.
member.remarks: This class provides a foundation for creating awaitable operations that complete when specific events are triggered. It integrates with the async/await pattern while working with the game's task system. Derived classes should implement the specific event subscription and un-subscription logic.

member.name: M:GameCore.Timers.EventWaiter.#ctor
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the EventWaiter class and starts waiting for the event.
member.remarks: The event waiter starts immediately upon construction and will remain active until the target event occurs or the operation is cancelled.

member.name: M:GameCore.Timers.EventWaiter.System#Runtime#CompilerServices#INotifyCompletion#OnCompleted(System.Action)
member.summary: Schedules a continuation action to be executed when the event occurs.
member.param: The action to execute when the event is triggered.
member.remarks: This method is part of the INotifyCompletion interface and is used by the async/await infrastructure to schedule code that should run after the event waiter completes.

member.name: M:GameCore.Timers.EventWaiter.GetAwaiter
member.summary: Gets the awaiter for this event waiter, enabling async/await syntax.
member.returns: This event waiter instance, which serves as its own awaiter.
member.remarks: This method is required for async/await support and allows the event waiter to be used directly in await expressions.

member.name: M:GameCore.Timers.EventWaiter.GetResult
member.summary: Gets the result of the event wait operation.
member.remarks: This method is called when the await operation completes. Since event waiters typically don't return specific values, this method performs no action.

member.name: M:GameCore.Timers.EventWaiter.StopSynchronous(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Immediately stops the event waiter and executes any pending continuation.
member.param: True if the event waiter completed successfully; false if it was cancelled.
member.returns: True if the event waiter was stopped successfully; otherwise, false.
member.remarks: This method performs the actual stopping logic including executing the continuation callback if the operation completed successfully and cleaning up resources.

member.name: M:GameCore.Timers.EventWaiter.ClearUpEvent
member.summary: Clears up event subscriptions and releases event-related resources.
member.remarks: This abstract method must be implemented by derived classes to define how event subscriptions are cleaned up when the waiter is stopped or cancelled. This prevents memory leaks and ensures proper resource management.

member.name: M:GameCore.Timers.EventWaiter.Stop(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Stops the event waiter and cleans up event subscriptions.
member.param: True if the event waiter is stopping because it completed successfully; false for cancellation.
member.returns: True if the stop operation was initiated successfully; otherwise, false.
member.remarks: This method extends the base Task stop behavior by also cleaning up event subscriptions before proceeding with the normal stop process.

member.name: T:GameCore.Timers.EventWaiter`1
member.summary: Represents an abstract base class for event waiters that are associated with a specific target object.
member.typeparam: The type of target object that this event waiter is associated with.
member.remarks: This generic version of EventWaiter provides a convenient way to create event waiters that are tied to specific objects, such as entities, components, or other game objects. The target object is automatically cleared when the event waiter is cleaned up to prevent memory leaks.
member.param: The target object that this event waiter is associated with.

member.name: M:GameCore.Timers.EventWaiter`1.#ctor(`0)
member.summary: Represents an abstract base class for event waiters that are associated with a specific target object.
member.typeparam: The type of target object that this event waiter is associated with.
member.remarks: This generic version of EventWaiter provides a convenient way to create event waiters that are tied to specific objects, such as entities, components, or other game objects. The target object is automatically cleared when the event waiter is cleaned up to prevent memory leaks.
member.param: The target object that this event waiter is associated with.

member.name: F:GameCore.Timers.EventWaiter`1.Target
member.summary: Gets the target object that this event waiter is associated with.
member.value: The target object, or null if the event waiter has been cleaned up.
member.remarks: This property provides access to the target object for derived classes to use in their event subscription logic. The target is automatically set to null during cleanup.

member.name: M:GameCore.Timers.EventWaiter`1.ClearUpEvent
member.summary: Clears the target reference to prevent memory leaks.
member.remarks: This implementation of ClearUpEvent sets the Target to null, which helps prevent memory leaks by breaking the reference to the target object. Derived classes can override this method to provide additional cleanup logic while still calling the base implementation.

member.name: T:GameCore.Timers.NeverEndingTask
member.summary: Represents a task that never completes, designed for scenarios where indefinite waiting is required.
member.remarks: This class provides a way to create awaitable operations that intentionally never complete. It's useful for scenarios where you need to block execution indefinitely, such as waiting for external events that may never occur, or creating placeholder tasks in testing scenarios. Since this task never completes, awaiting it will block the calling code indefinitely unless cancelled through other means.

member.name: M:GameCore.Timers.NeverEndingTask.GetAwaiter
member.summary: Gets the awaiter for this never-ending task, enabling async/await syntax.
member.returns: This task instance, which serves as its own awaiter.
member.remarks: This method is required for async/await support. Since the task never completes, any code awaiting this task will block indefinitely unless interrupted by external means.

member.name: M:GameCore.Timers.NeverEndingTask.GetResult
member.summary: Gets the result of the never-ending task.
member.remarks: Since this task never completes, this method should never be called under normal circumstances. If called, it performs no action as there is no meaningful result to return from a task that never finishes.

member.name: M:GameCore.Timers.NeverEndingTask.System#Runtime#CompilerServices#INotifyCompletion#OnCompleted(System.Action)
member.summary: Schedules a continuation action to be executed when the task completes.
member.param: The action to execute upon completion.
member.remarks: Since this task never completes, the continuation will never be executed. This method is part of the INotifyCompletion interface but performs no action for a never-ending task.

member.name: T:GameCore.Timers.NextTick
member.summary: Represents an awaitable operation that completes after the next game tick occurs.
member.remarks: This class is useful when you need to delay execution by exactly one frame or game tick. It's commonly used to ensure operations happen after all current frame processing is complete, or to break up long-running operations across multiple frames.

member.name: M:GameCore.Timers.NextTick.#ctor(System.Nullable{System.Threading.CancellationToken})
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.
member.param: An optional cancellation token to cancel the wait operation.
member.remarks: The operation will complete after the next game tick unless cancelled via the token.

member.name: M:GameCore.Timers.NextTick.GetResult
member.summary: Gets the result of the next tick operation.
member.returns: Always returns true when the next tick completes.

member.name: M:GameCore.Timers.NextTick.ThinkAction(System.Int32)
member.summary: Marks that a tick has occurred during the think operation.
member.param: The time delta for this tick (unused in this implementation).

member.name: M:GameCore.Timers.NextTick.ThinkFinish
member.summary: Determines whether the next tick operation should finish.
member.returns: true if a tick has occurred; otherwise, false.

member.name: T:GameCore.Timers.SyncedDelay
member.summary: A specialized timer that provides server-side precise timing with client-side time synchronization. Used for scenarios where server needs precise control while clients need to display timing information.

remarks.para: This class is designed for use cases like Buff durations, where: - Server side uses precise for timing control and game logic - Client side gets synchronized timing information for UI display
This class is lighter weight and focused specifically on the timing display use case rather than full cooldown management functionality.

member.name: P:GameCore.Timers.SyncedDelay.Duration
member.summary: Gets the total duration of this synced delay.
member.value: The original duration specified when the delay was created.

member.name: P:GameCore.Timers.SyncedDelay.RemainingTime
member.summary: Gets the remaining time before the delay completes.
member.value: A representing the remaining duration, or null if not started or paused.

remarks.para: On the server side, this returns the precise remaining time from the internal object. On the client side, this returns the synchronized time from the cooldown system.
When paused, this property returns null on the client side to indicate that the timing display should be hidden.

member.name: P:GameCore.Timers.SyncedDelay.IsRunning
member.summary: Gets a value indicating whether the delay is currently running.
member.value: True if the delay is running; false if it has completed, been stopped, or not yet started.

member.name: P:GameCore.Timers.SyncedDelay.IsCompleted
member.summary: Gets a value indicating whether the delay has completed.
member.value: True if the delay has finished; otherwise, false.

member.name: M:GameCore.Timers.SyncedDelay.#ctor(System.TimeSpan,GameCore.BaseInterface.ICooldownHost,System.Int64,System.Nullable{System.Threading.CancellationToken},System.Int32)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.
member.param: The duration for the delay.
The cooldown host for client synchronization.
The unique hash for the cooldown synchronization.
Optional cancellation token to monitor for cancellation requests.
Optional time adjustment in milliseconds to add to the duration.
member.exception: Thrown when is null.
Thrown when is negative.

member.name: M:GameCore.Timers.SyncedDelay.WaitForCompletion
member.summary: Starts the delay and returns a task that completes when the delay finishes.
member.returns: A task that represents the delay operation. The result is the remaining time in milliseconds when completed.

remarks.para: On the server side, this creates the internal object and sets up cooldown synchronization for clients. The returned task will complete when the delay finishes.
On the client side, this returns an already completed task since client-side timing is controlled by server synchronization.

member.name: M:GameCore.Timers.SyncedDelay.Pause(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Pauses or resumes the delay execution.
member.param: True to pause the delay; false to resume it.

remarks.para: When paused, the server-side stops counting down and the cooldown synchronization is cleared from clients. When resumed, cooldown synchronization is restarted with the current remaining time.
This method has no effect if the delay has not been started or has already completed.

member.name: M:GameCore.Timers.SyncedDelay.SetRemainingTime(System.TimeSpan)
member.summary: Sets the remaining time for the delay to a new value.
member.param: The new remaining time for the delay.
member.returns: True if the remaining time was successfully set; false if the delay has not started or has completed.
member.remarks: This method allows modification of the remaining time of an active delay. Both the server-side delay and client-side synchronization are updated.

member.name: M:GameCore.Timers.SyncedDelay.Stop
member.summary: Stops the delay immediately.
member.remarks: This cancels the server-side delay and clears the client-side cooldown synchronization.

member.name: M:GameCore.Timers.SyncedDelay.MonitorCompletion
member.summary: Monitors the completion of the internal delay and handles cleanup.

member.name: M:GameCore.Timers.SyncedDelay.ToString
member.summary: Returns a string representation of the synced delay.
member.returns: A string containing the delay's duration and remaining time information.

member.name: T:GameCore.Timers.Timer

member.name: P:GameCore.Timers.Timer.SynchronizingObject

member.name: M:GameCore.Timers.Timer.Close
member.summary: Disposes of the resources (other than memory) used by the .

member.name: T:GameCore.UserCloudData.CloudDataApi
member.summary: 云数据统一访问入口，提供查询和事务操作的一致API

remarks.para: 该类作为云数据系统的主要入口点，解决了查询和修改操作分离的不一致问题。
所有云数据操作都可以从此类开始，提供统一的用户体验。
底层委托给 和 实现。

list.item: Player.Id: 当局游戏的槽位编号(0,1,2...)，仅在当前游戏会话有意义
User.UserId: 平台用户的全局唯一标识，云数据应使用此ID确保持久性

member.name: T:GameCore.UserCloudData.CloudDataManager
member.summary: 云数据管理器，负责管理云数据提供者的生命周期和异步响应处理

remarks.para: 该类是云数据系统的底层管理组件，负责:
- 管理 的初始化和生命周期
- 处理来自Provider的异步事件响应
- 维护请求ID到等待器的映射关系
- 提供日志记录和错误处理

member.name: T:GameCore.UserCloudData.CloudDataOperations
member.summary: 云数据操作实现类，提供所有云数据操作的具体实现

remarks.para: 该类是云数据系统的中间层，负责:
- 实现所有云数据查询和事务操作
- 提供参数验证和错误处理
- 管理请求ID生成和异步等待
- 封装底层Provider调用

member.name: F:GameCore.UserCloudData.CloudDataOperations._requestIdNext
member.summary: 请求ID生成器，用于标识每个异步请求

member.name: M:GameCore.UserCloudData.CloudDataOperations.QueryUserDataBatchAsync(System.Int64[],System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable{EngineInterface.BaseType.VarChar180})
member.summary: 异步批量查询指定用户的通用数据
member.param: 要查询的用户ID数组，不能为null或空
要检索的数据键集合，每个键不超过180个UTF-8字符，不能为null或空
member.returns: 包含查询结果的任务。成功时返回 集合， 失败时返回相应的错误代码。结果可能为空但不会为null。

remarks.para: 该方法支持批量查询多个用户的多个数据键，适用于需要同时获取大量用户数据的场景。
查询结果按用户分组，每个用户的数据包含BigInt、VarChar和Blob三种类型。

member.exception: 当userIds或keys为null时
当userIds或keys为空时

member.name: M:GameCore.UserCloudData.CloudDataOperations.QueryUserNameBatchAsync(System.Int64[])
member.summary: 异步批量查询指定用户的平台用户名数据
member.param: 要查询的用户ID数组，不能为null或空
member.returns: 包含用户平台用户名查询结果的任务。成功时返回 对象， 失败时返回相应的错误代码。结果可能为空但不会为null。

remarks.para: 该方法支持批量查询多个用户的名称信息，适用于需要同时获取大量用户名称的场景。
查询结果包含用户ID和对应的名称，如果某个用户没有设置名称，则返回空字符串。
可以通过返回的 对象的 方法获取特定用户的名称。

member.exception: 当userIds为null时
当userIds为空时

member.name: M:GameCore.UserCloudData.CloudDataOperations.QueryCurrencyBatchAsync(System.Int64[],System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable{EngineInterface.BaseType.VarChar180})
member.summary: 异步批量查询指定用户的货币数据
member.param: 要查询的用户ID数组，不能为null或空
要检索的货币键集合，每个键不超过180个UTF-8字符，不能为null或空
member.returns: 包含查询结果的任务。成功时返回 集合， 失败时返回相应的错误代码。

remarks.para: 货币数据具有特殊的原子性保证，支持AddCurrency和CostCurrency等事务操作。
货币值不能为负数，CostCurrency操作会验证余额充足性。

member.name: M:GameCore.UserCloudData.CloudDataOperations.QueryCappedDataBatchAsync(System.Int64[],System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable{EngineInterface.BaseType.VarChar180})
member.summary: 异步批量查询指定用户的有上限数据
member.param: 要查询的用户ID数组，不能为null或空
要检索的数据键集合，每个键不超过180个UTF-8字符，不能为null或空
member.returns: 包含查询结果的任务。成功时返回 集合， 失败时返回相应的错误代码。

remarks.para: 有上限数据支持动态调整上限值，常用于体力、经验等有最大值限制的数值。
可以通过 操作修改数值和上限。

member.name: M:GameCore.UserCloudData.CloudDataOperations.CheckNameClaimedStatusAsync(EngineInterface.BaseType.VarChar180,EngineInterface.BaseType.VarChar180)
member.summary: 异步检查指定名称在给定命名空间中是否已被占用
member.param: 命名空间键，不超过180个UTF-8字符，不能为空
要检查的名称，不超过180个UTF-8字符，不能为空
member.returns: 包含名称占用状态的任务。成功时返回 ， 失败时返回相应的错误代码。

remarks.para: 名称系统提供全局唯一性保证，常用于玩家昵称、公会名称等需要唯一标识的场景。
名称一旦被占用，可以通过 DeleteName 操作进行删除，或通过新的 ClaimNewName 操作占用其他名称。

member.name: M:GameCore.UserCloudData.CloudDataOperations.SearchClaimedNamesAsync(EngineInterface.BaseType.VarChar180,EngineInterface.BaseType.VarChar180)
member.summary: 异步搜索包含指定部分名称的已占用名称
member.param: 命名空间键，不超过180个UTF-8字符，不能为空
要搜索的部分名称，支持模糊匹配，不能为空
member.returns: 包含匹配名称记录的任务。成功时返回 集合， 失败时返回相应的错误代码。最多返回15个结果。

remarks.para: 该方法执行大小写不敏感的部分匹配搜索，适用于名称联想和重复检查。
为了防止性能问题，单次搜索最多返回15个匹配结果。

member.name: M:GameCore.UserCloudData.CloudDataOperations.QueryUserListItemsAsync(System.Int64,EngineInterface.BaseType.VarChar180,System.Nullable{System.Int32})
member.summary: 异步查询指定用户的列表项数据
member.param: 用户ID，必须大于0
列表键，不超过180个UTF-8字符，不能为空
最大返回数量，如果指定则返回最新的指定数量的项目，null表示返回所有项目
member.returns: 包含列表项记录的任务。成功时返回 集合， 失败时返回相应的错误代码。

remarks.para: 列表项按时间倒序排列，最新添加的项目排在前面。
如果指定了maxCount，将返回最新的指定数量的项目。
列表项支持添加、修改和删除操作，可以存储任意二进制数据。

member.name: M:GameCore.UserCloudData.CloudDataOperations.FindListItemByIdAsync(System.Int64)
member.summary: 异步通过全局唯一ID查找列表项
member.param: 列表项的全局唯一标识符
member.returns: 包含查找结果的任务。成功时返回 ， 指示是否找到项目以及项目数据，失败时返回相应的错误代码。

remarks.para: 该方法通过全局唯一ID进行精确查找，不需要指定用户ID或列表键。
返回的 提供类型安全的空值检查。

member.name: M:GameCore.UserCloudData.CloudDataOperations.ExecuteTransactionAsync(System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable{EngineInterface.BaseType.TransactionOperation},EngineInterface.BaseType.VarChar255)
member.summary: 异步执行云数据事务，如果任何操作失败，整个事务将被回滚
member.param: 要执行的事务操作集合，不能为null或空
事务描述，将存储到数据库中用于审计，不超过255个UTF-8字符
member.returns: 包含事务执行结果的任务。成功时返回 ， 失败时返回相应的错误代码。

remarks.para: 事务提供ACID特性保证，所有操作要么全部成功，要么全部失败。
支持的操作类型包括：数据设置/删除、货币加减、列表项管理、名称占用等。
事务描述将记录在审计日志中，建议提供有意义的描述信息。

member.remarks: 委托给 实现。

member.name: M:GameCore.UserCloudData.TransactionBuilder.ModifyCappedData(System.String,System.Int64,System.Int64,EngineInterface.BaseType.UserDataResetOption)
member.summary: 修改有上限的数据，若修改后的值超过上限，则整个事务失败。 若从未设置过指定Key的数据，则设置上限为newCap，并设置当前值为delta。
member.param: 数据键，不超过180个UTF-8字符
变化量，可以为正数（增加）或负数（减少）
新的上限值，必须大于等于0

重置选项，控制数据何时自动重置为0。可选值：
: 每N小时重置
: 每N天重置
: 每N周的指定星期重置
: 每N月重置
: 每N年重置
: 永不重置（默认）
member.returns: 当前构建器实例，支持链式调用

remarks.para: 此方法用于管理具有上限限制的数据，如体力、经验池等。
计算逻辑：新值 = 当前值 + delta，如果新值 > newCap，则事务失败。
重置选项可以实现定期重置功能，例如每日体力恢复、每周活跃度重置等。
如果数据不存在，则从0开始计算。

member.exception: 当key为空或超过长度限制时
当newCap小于0时

member.name: T:GameCore.VitalSystem.Data.GameDataVital
member.summary: 表示活力值系统的数据配置，定义单位的活力值属性。活力是生命值、法力值、怒气值等拥有当前值/最大值的属性的统称。
member.remarks: 此类用于配置单位的活力值相关属性，包括当前活力值类型和最大活力值的引用。 它作为活力值系统的数据基础，允许灵活地定义不同单位的活力值特征。

member.name: P:GameCore.VitalSystem.Data.GameDataVital.Current
member.summary: 获取或设置当前活力值属性的类型
member.remarks: 定义此活力值数据所对应的具体属性类型，例如生命值、魔法值等。 这个属性决定了活力值组件将管理哪种类型的数值。

member.name: P:GameCore.VitalSystem.Data.GameDataVital.Max
member.summary: 获取或设置最大活力值属性的数据链接
member.remarks: 引用定义最大活力值的单位属性数据。这个链接指向具体的单位属性配置， 允许系统动态获取和计算单位的最大活力值上限。

member.name: T:GameCore.VitalSystem.Vital
member.summary: Represents a vital property of an entity such as health, mana, or energy that has current and maximum values with regeneration.
member.remarks: The Vital class manages dynamic properties that typically change during gameplay, such as health points, mana points, or stamina. Each vital has a current value, maximum value, and regeneration rate. The system automatically handles clamping values within valid ranges and applies regeneration over time. Vitals are implemented as tag components, meaning each entity can have one vital per property type.

member.name: P:GameCore.VitalSystem.Vital.PropertyMax
member.summary: Gets the game data link that defines how the maximum value of this vital is calculated.
member.value: A game data link to the unit property configuration that determines the maximum value.
member.remarks: The maximum value may be influenced by various factors such as level, equipment, buffs, and other modifiers. The actual maximum value is calculated dynamically through the unit property system.

member.name: M:GameCore.VitalSystem.Vital.PendingFinalizer
member.summary: Marks this vital for finalization to ensure values are clamped within valid ranges.

member.name: M:GameCore.VitalSystem.Vital.#ctor(GameCore.EntitySystem.Entity,GameCore.BaseType.PropertyVital,GameData.IGameLink{GameCore.Data.GameDataUnitProperty})
member.param: The entity that owns this vital property.
The property tag that identifies this vital type.
The game data link that defines the maximum value calculation for this vital.

member.name: T:GameCore.VitalSystem.Vital.Property
member.summary: Defines the different properties of a vital that can be modified.

member.name: F:GameCore.VitalSystem.Vital.Property.Current
member.summary: The current value of the vital (e.g., current health points).

member.name: F:GameCore.VitalSystem.Vital.Property.Regen
member.summary: The regeneration rate of the vital (how much it recovers per tick).

member.name: M:GameCore.VitalSystem.Vital.Modify(System.Double,GameCore.VitalSystem.Vital.Property,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Modifies a vital property by adding the specified amount to its current value.
member.param: The amount to add to the property (can be negative for reduction).
The specific vital property to modify.
Whether to immediately clamp the value within valid ranges.
member.remarks: This method adds the specified amount to the current value of the property. For healing or damage, use positive or negative amounts respectively. If doFinalize is false, the value clamping will be deferred until the end of the current tick for better performance.

member.name: M:GameCore.VitalSystem.Vital.SetMax(System.Double,GameCore.BaseType.PropertySubType,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Sets the maximum value of this vital property.
member.param: The maximum value to set.
The sub-type of the property to set.
Whether to immediately clamp the value within valid ranges.
member.remarks: This method sets the maximum value of this vital property. The value will be automatically clamped to valid ranges (0 to maximum) if doFinalize is true, or at the end of the current tick if doFinalize is false.

member.name: M:GameCore.VitalSystem.Vital.Set(System.Double,GameCore.VitalSystem.Vital.Property,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Sets a vital property to the specified absolute value.
member.param: The absolute value to set the property to.
The specific vital property to modify.
Whether to immediately clamp the value within valid ranges.
member.remarks: This method sets the property to an absolute value rather than adding to it. The value will be automatically clamped to valid ranges (0 to maximum) if doFinalize is true, or at the end of the current tick if doFinalize is false.

member.name: P:GameCore.VitalSystem.Vital.Current
member.summary: Gets the current value of this vital property.
member.value: The current amount of this vital (e.g., current health points).
member.remarks: This value represents the actual usable amount of the vital resource. It will always be between 0 and the maximum value, unless modifications are pending finalization.

member.name: P:GameCore.VitalSystem.Vital.Max
member.summary: Gets the maximum value of this vital property.
member.value: The maximum amount this vital can reach (e.g., maximum health points).
member.remarks: The maximum value is calculated dynamically based on the entity's properties, level, equipment, and other modifiers. This value may change as the entity's stats change.

member.name: P:GameCore.VitalSystem.Vital.Regen
member.summary: Gets or sets the regeneration rate of this vital property.
member.value: The rate at which this vital regenerates per tick.
member.remarks: Positive values indicate regeneration (healing over time), while negative values indicate degeneration (damage over time). The actual regeneration is applied each game tick.

member.name: M:GameCore.VitalSystem.Vital.Think(System.Int32)
member.summary: Processes the regeneration logic for this vital on each game tick.
member.param: The time delta since the last tick (currently unused).
member.remarks: This method is called automatically by the game's thinking system. It applies regeneration and schedules finalization to ensure values stay within valid ranges. The method only processes regeneration on the server side.

member.name: M:GameCore.VitalSystem.Vital.TickFinalizer
member.summary: Finalizes vital values by clamping them within valid ranges and updating thinking status.
member.remarks: This method ensures that the current value stays between 0 and the maximum value. It also determines whether this vital needs to continue thinking based on its regeneration rate and current value. This method is called automatically at the end of each tick.

member.name: M:GameCore.VitalSystem.Vital.DisposeManaged
member.summary: Releases managed resources used by this vital.
member.remarks: This method is called when the vital is being disposed. It cleans up references to the unit property system and calls the base disposal method.

member.name: M:GameCore.VitalSystem.Vital.ToString
member.summary: Returns a string representation of this vital showing its current state.
member.returns: A formatted string containing the vital's tag, current/max values, regeneration rate (if non-zero), and sync ID.

member.name: T:GameUI.CameraSystem.Data.GameDataCamera
member.summary: This class is used to store camera data for the game.

member.name: P:GameUI.CameraSystem.Data.GameDataCamera.TargetingMode
member.summary: Gets or sets the camera's targeting mode, which determines how the camera targets or interacts with entities or the scene.

member.name: P:GameUI.CameraSystem.Data.GameDataCamera.PositionBias
member.summary: Gets or sets the bias applied to the camera's position. This value is used to adjust the camera's position relative to the target entity or focal point.

member.name: P:GameUI.CameraSystem.Data.GameDataCamera.TargetX
member.summary: Gets or sets the target X-coordinate value when the camera is focused on a fixed position.

member.name: P:GameUI.CameraSystem.Data.GameDataCamera.TargetY
member.summary: Gets or sets the target Y-coordinate value when the camera is focused on a fixed position.

member.name: P:GameUI.CameraSystem.Data.GameDataCamera.TargetZOffset
member.summary: Gets or sets the target offset along the Z-axis. when the camera is in a fixed position, this value is used to determine the Z coordinate of the target point. When the camera is following a target entity, this value is used to determine the Z offset based on the target entity's position.

member.name: P:GameUI.CameraSystem.Data.GameDataCamera.PositionMode
member.summary: Gets or sets the mode that determines how the camera's position is calculated.
member.remarks: Use this property to specify whether the camera's position is determined relative to a focal point, a target object, or another reference mode defined by the enumeration.

member.name: P:GameUI.CameraSystem.Data.GameDataCamera.Rotation
member.summary: Gets or sets the rotation of the camera in 3D space.

member.name: P:GameUI.CameraSystem.Data.GameDataCamera.RotationOrder
member.summary: Gets or sets the order in which rotations are applied to the camera. This will affect the final orientation of the camera when multiple rotations are applied.

member.name: P:GameUI.CameraSystem.Data.GameDataCamera.FocalLength
member.summary: The focal length of the camera.

member.name: P:GameUI.CameraSystem.Data.GameDataCamera.FieldOfView
member.summary: Gets or sets the camera's field of view (FOV) in degrees. This property determines how wide the camera's view is, with larger values providing a wider view and smaller values providing a narrower view.

member.name: P:GameUI.CameraSystem.Data.GameDataCamera.FieldOfViewFor2K
member.summary: Gets or sets the field of view for 2K resolution.

member.name: P:GameUI.CameraSystem.Data.GameDataCamera.NearClipPlane
member.summary: Gets or sets the distance to the near clipping plane of the camera.

member.name: P:GameUI.CameraSystem.Data.GameDataCamera.FarClipPlane
member.summary: Gets or sets the distance to the far clipping plane of the camera.

member.name: P:GameUI.CameraSystem.Data.GameDataCamera.Orthographic
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether the camera uses an orthographic projection.

member.name: P:GameUI.CameraSystem.Data.GameDataCamera.UseSpringArm
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether the spring arm mechanism is enabled. This mechanism is used to create a smooth camera movement by simulating a spring effect.

member.name: P:GameUI.CameraSystem.Data.GameDataCamera.SceneBounds
member.summary: Used to constrain the camera's movement to a specific area. The camera will not be able to move focal point outside the bounds from the current scene.

member.name: P:GameUI.CameraSystem.Data.GameDataCamera.DisplayDebugInfo
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether debug information should be displayed.

member.name: P:GameUI.CameraSystem.Data.GameDataCamera.FollowMainUnitByDefault
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether the system should follow the main unit of the local player by default.

member.name: P:GameUI.CameraSystem.Data.GameDataCamera.FollowMoveTime
member.summary: Determines the speed at which the camera moves when following a target entity. This value is used to smooth out the camera's movement and make it feel more natural.

member.name: P:GameUI.CameraSystem.Data.GameDataCamera.FollowMoveRateRange
member.summary: Gets or sets the range of movement rates for following behavior.

member.name: P:GameUI.CameraSystem.Data.GameDataCamera.FreeTargetChangeThreshold
member.summary: Gets or sets the threshold distance near the viewport's border at which the cursor or finger touch triggers a change in the camera's focal target during free control mode.
member.remarks: This property defines the sensitivity of the camera's focal target adjustment when the cursor or touch input moves close to the edges of the viewport. A smaller value makes the camera more responsive to edge proximity, while a larger value requires the input to be closer to the border.

member.name: P:GameUI.CameraSystem.Data.GameDataCamera.ZoomFocalLengthRate
member.summary: Determines the speed at which the camera zooms in and out when using the mouse wheel or touch gestures, measured in focal length units per wheel tick.

member.name: P:GameUI.CameraSystem.Data.GameDataCamera.ZoomRotationRange
member.summary: Gets or sets the range of camera rotation allowed during zoom operations.

member.name: P:GameUI.CameraSystem.Data.GameDataCamera.ZoomStageCount
member.summary: Determines the number of zoom stages available when using the mouse wheel to zoom in and out.
